characters: YOU EARNED IT DUDE... YOUR A WARRIOR
IN A 20TH ANNIVERSARY REMATCH OF THEIR LEGENDERY EPIC
J.T. SEXXY, CORPORAL PUNISHMENT, CHRIS COLUMBO...
PS... IF YOUR UP BY THE 23RD, I GOT SOMETHING IN YONKERS
IVAN PETROV, THE SANDBAGGERS, BILLY BOB BANJO,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present day. Post-match. Randy, pushing 50, still with th same long, dyed-blond mane, sits on a bench in the boys locker room of a Wilmington, Delaware high school.

dialogues.speaker: CHYRON
dialogues.text: He pulls off his purple spandex wrestling tights. Lime-gr ram’s horns run up the sides. They’re the same kind of ti as in the ‘80s pics—and may well be the actual same pair. Naked except for a jockstrap, Randy takes a breath. Achy, sweaty, saggy, exhausted. A battered warrior. Scars all o his body. Despite the rough shape he’s in, it’s clear he’ just given it his all in the ring. He swigs down a few pi with a beer. Promoter SCOTT BRUMBERG, a heavyset man in a Mets jersey BRUMBERG - 44 on the back, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: Great show, Ram. Ya turned it out. (a little sad) As always. He hands Randy some cash. Randy counts it. It’s not much. SCOTT BRUMBERG (CONT’D) Sorry. I was sure the gate’d be bigger. Randy just shrugs resignedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, changed into his street clothes, limps out of the school, each step labored and painful. Waiting near the entrance are TWO FANS, both men in their 30s.

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: Yo, Ram. Think you could...? Fan #1 holds out a SHARPIE and an old WRESTLING PROGRAM f the ‘80s. On the cover is a shot of Randy wrestling CORPO PUNISHMENT, a heel in a drill instructor get-up. Randy takes the program, happy to oblige.

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: I was there. Randy hands back the program. FAN #2 hands him a MINI-PO The faded, mid-'’80s poster features Randy, biceps bulgin crushing a head of broccoli between his fists. Across the top, it says “EAT YOUR VEGETABLES, PUNK!"

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: (as Randy signs) My first match ever was you versus Davey Diamond at the Spectrum. (nostalgic) 1985... Randy smiles a little. He remembers, too. He hands back t poster. Fan #2 looks fondly at Randy, a part of his boyho

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: (vaguely sad) You were awesome. Randy nods, a bit uncomfortably. The two fans, muttering thanks, drift off into the Delaware night. Randy is left standing alone, still holding Fan #1'’s pen. He walks over to a beat-up old CONVERSION VAN and climbs Turns on the engine. Music starts up on the stereo mid-so MUSIC: CINDERELLA - “DON’T KNOW WHAT YOU GOT (TIL IT’S GO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is driving. On the dashboard is an old ACTION FIGUR HIMSELF from his WWF days. On the stereo, a different son plays, later in the same album. MUSIC: CINDERELLA - “FIRE AND ICE” Randy pulls into the entrance gate of PARADISE OAKS TRAIL PARK. EXT. PARADISE OAKS - RANDY’S TRAILER - SHORT TIME LATER Randy parks in front of his TRAILER. He gets out and head toward it. A dismayed look comes over his face. RANDY'S POV: The door is PADLOCKED. He tugs on the lock. Tugs on the door. No dice. He violently kicks the padlock in a moment of rage.  EXT. RANDY’S TRAILER - SHORT TIME LATER Randy resignedly climbs into the BACK OF HIS VAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies on a scrunched-up mattress on the floor, unabl sleep. The van wall is decorated with a MINI-SHRINE Randy has bu to himself. Old magazine and newspaper clippings, mini- posters, etc. A few changes of clothes lie in a messy hea the corner. He grabs a bottle of pills and pops a few, washing them d with a beer. He closes his eyes, trying to unwind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is asleep in his clothes from the night before. He’ STIRRED AWAKE by the sound of kids YELLING and BANGING on outside of van. KID’S VOICE (0.S.) Ram! He slowly sits upright, massaging his pain-wracked knees. Every inch of him feels like shit. ANOTHER KID’S VOICE (0.S.) Raaam! RANDY'S POV: Through the front windshield, TWO 8-YEAR-OLD KIDS, boosted by TWO OTHER KIDS, are peering in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is playfully tussling with the four kids. He picks of them up and “bodyslams” him.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (announcer voice) Oh, my... look out! He picks up another one and fake-drops him on his head.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Suplex! He slams a third one. The kids are squealing with deligh

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tombstone piledriver! Randy sees a car drive up and park by the MANAGER'S OFFIC He watches it with interest.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Catch you maniacs later... The kids moan with disappointment as Randy heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy glares at Len, the trailer park’s MANAGER.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: C'mon, Len. Don’t be such a fuckin’ ballbreaker.

dialogues.speaker: LEN THE MANAGER
dialogues.text: You'll get in when I get my rent.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You know I’m good for it.

dialogues.speaker: LEN THE MANAGER
dialogues.text: Sure. You’re good for it every time this happens. Randy sigh-groans in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Can I at least park in back? Len looks at Randy. A wave of pity comes over him.

dialogues.speaker: LEN THE MANAGER
dialogues.text: Twenty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits on a MILK CRATE by his parked van. On the grou in front of him is a BLENDER connected to an extension co stretching to another TRAILER. He pours a protein-shake packet into the blender. The trailer door opens. A WOMAN comes out. Lighting a cigarette, she looks up at the cloudless, starry sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Meg. She gives Randy a small “You got it” wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy enters a suburban Shop-Rite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sticks his head in a door marked MANAGER'S OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Hey, Wayne. INT. WAYNE’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Sitting behind a desk is store manager WAYNE (40). He loo up at Randy, irked.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Do we not know how to knock? Wayne casually clicks a porn site closed on his computer.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's try that again. Randy steps out and closes the door behind him. He knocks

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come in! Randy enters.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Randy! What can I do for you? Randy groans privately. He really hates Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Do you have any extra shifts you could throw my way?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: What’s the matter, they raise the price of tights?  Randy is not amused. Wayne grabs a LOOSELEAF BINDER.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s see what we got. Wayne starts flipping through.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Pretty much anything weekday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, working alongside some MEXICAN GUYS, lifts a STACK BOXES off the back of a BOAR’S HEAD DELIVERY TRUCK. He carries the boxes through a RUBBER-STRIP CURTAIN, into WALK-IN COOLER. He puts them down and heads back out agai

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. OGDEN’S GYM —- LOCKER ROOM - DAY Randy stands with GREGG, a huge bodybuilder who’s countin off some bills. Randy growls with displeasure at the smal liquid-filled GLASS BOTTLE in his hand. ANGLE ON bottle: The label says SUSTANON 250. The rest of label is in SPANISH.

dialogues.speaker: GREGG
dialogues.text: I’m tellin’ ya, bro, it’s identical to the German.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I tried Mexican sus once. Gave me bitch tits.

dialogues.speaker: GREGG
dialogues.text: Years ago, right? Mexican’s way better now.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I don’t want this.

dialogues.speaker: GREGG
dialogues.text: Bro, it’s the same.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I want my German.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don’t have any.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Randy steps in front of Gregg’s locker and starts ROOTING AROUND.

dialogues.speaker: GREGG
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Randy finds a bottle with GERMAN WRITING on it.

dialogues.speaker: GREGG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s my own stash. That’s my last one. Randy puts the bottle of Mexican sustanon in the locker a walks off with the German.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Danke schoen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, underwear pulled down, plunges a needle into his a cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is BENCHPRESSING. He grunts loudly as he squeezes o one more rep, his SPOTTER urging him on.

dialogues.speaker: SPOTTER
dialogues.text: Push it out—you got this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strip-mall tanning salon. Randy breezes in, nodding hel to the FRONT-DESK WOMAN, who’s on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: How ya doin’, Glor?

dialogues.speaker: FRONT-DESK WOMAN
dialogues.text: (cupping phone) Hey, babe. Four’s open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON an upright tanning pod. INSIDE THE POD, Randy is standing naked, baking under the UV lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits in a chair as a KOREAN LADY wearing latex glov BLEACHES HIS ROOTS. His hair is full of plastic clips.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Don’t leave it in too long. All those pieces broke off last time.

dialogues.speaker: KOREAN LADY
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: GREAT WHITE - “ONCE BITTEN TWICE SHY” Randy is driving along Route 21. “Once Bitten Twice Shy” blasting on the stereo. One hand on the wheel, he bangs o the song’s piano riff on the dash with the other. He passes Cheetah’s, a STRIP CLUB. He keeps an eye on it he drives past. The song fades out. He pops the tape out of the deck and tosses it on the passenger seat. On it is a messy pile of cassettes. Skid Row. Métley Criie. AC/DC. Guns ‘N’ Roses. sifts through the selection, one eye on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: AC/DC - “BACK IN BLACK” Randy is still driving. AC/DC's “Back In Black” cranks lo He pulls into the parking lot of a VFW HALL and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A makeshift locker room/staging area. Randy and 20 or so other WRESTLERS stand before the event’s sleazy, tracksui clad promoter, NICK VOLPE.  10.

dialogues.speaker: NICK VOLPE
dialogues.text: Listen up, only saying it once. Vic Storm, you’re up first against D- Day. Second, Shawn McPride and Funkmaster Garry B. Slick. Third, Frankie Cirillo and Rob Dynamo versus J.T. Anvil and The Ultimate Freak. Fourth, Teddy Brewski and Lex Lethal. Intermission. Fifth, Samoan Savages versus the Disco Brothers. Sixth, the Irish Warrior and Vyper. Seventh, “Sandman” Steve Sambuca versus Hollywood. Last but not least, for the strap, Kid Loco versus Randy The Ram. Got it? Good. Volpe walks off. INT. CAFETERIA —- SHORT TIME LATER Randy sits alone a table toward the back. He takes a roll athletic tape out of his supplies-filled WHEELIE TRAVEL B He starts WRAPPING HIS KNEES AND ANKLES. He does it ina slow, methodical manner. It feels almost ritualistic. INT. CAFETERIA —- SHORT TIME LATER Randy is hashing out the match with his opponent, a wiry Puerto Rican kid whose shiny vinyl pants identify him as LOCO (22).

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Right there, you post me. Hard. I show color. Kid Loco nods, listening closely, deferential to the lege

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You post me again. Again. (Kid Loco nods) You're fuckin’ whalin’ on my ass.

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ram. Randy turns and sees fellow wrestler LEX LETHAL sticking head into the cafeteria door.

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s some chick out here looking for you.  11.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) Some chick.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Ring rat?

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy emerges from the cafeteria. A look of PLEASED SURPR comes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What’s up, kiddo? RANDY'S POV: Standing there in an otherwise empty hallway a plain-ish YOUNG WOMAN (22). She looks at him with an unsmiling expression. This is STEPHANIE.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Long time no see. Randy pulls her in for a hug. She doesn’t really hug back She steps back, breaking off the hug. A brief, awkward pa

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whatcha doing here? Here to root on your old man? She shakes her head no.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s okay—as long as you’re not rooting against me! She is irked by his jokiness.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Is there someplace we can talk?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I’m on in a sec.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: It won’t take much of your time.  12.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I’m here because... Stephanie gathers herself. This isn’t easy for her.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I came to make amends.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Amends?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I’m supposed to talk to people I’ve hurt. Randy is puzzled for a moment. Then, it clicks in.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Ohh... 12-stepper.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: (nods ) AA.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Good for you. That’s great.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Thank you. I’m sure you mean that.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I do. She smile-nods insincerely. RANDY (CONT’D) So's that it?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I need to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: For anything I’ve done or said over the years. All the anger at you.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Okay...  13.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Like the last time I saw you... I’m sorry for what I said.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (dismissive wave) Don’t worry about it. Stephanie is irked by his lack of engagement. She looks a him with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Do you even know what I said?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It was about your mom. And me. (vague, flailing) Like, how I was bad.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Raa-am! Randy turns and sees TWO MEATHEAD FANS down the hall, hea his way.

dialogues.speaker: MEATHEAD
dialogues.text: Whassup, yo? Randy The Ram! MEATHEAD #1 gives Randy an excited high-five.

dialogues.speaker: MEATHEAD
dialogues.text: We gonna see some action tonight?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (sly grin) Tonight’s forecast calls for severe butt-whoopin’s with a 100 percent chance of pain. Psyched “Yeah!”"s from the meatheads. Stephanie is pissed the interruption. And, even more, Randy’s embrace of it.

dialogues.speaker: MEATHEAD
dialogues.text: Could we get a picture?  14.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: No problemo. The two meatheads flank Randy, their arms around his broa shoulders. Meathead #1 looks tentatively at Stephanie, holding up his DIGITAL CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: MEATHEAD
dialogues.text: Think you could...? She coldly takes it.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: No problemo. She looks into the camera. The meatheads stick their tong out and throw up devil signs. Randy flexes theatrically, making his best “Aaargh!” wrestling face. Stephanie snaps a shot. Meathead #1 takes back his camera and his buddy pat Randy heartily on the back.

dialogues.speaker: MEATHEAD
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot, yo. Kick some ass out there.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You know it, broski! The meatheads excitedly head off. Randy turns his attention back to Stephanie, who’s glarin him with cold disgust. RANDY (CONT’D) What?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Same shit.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: They’re fans.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Same old shit.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I hafta. It’s work.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I’m in the middle of saying something important and you drop it for the fucking wrestling.  15.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I didn’t ask them to come over.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: It’s like I’m 10 all over again.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Are we almost done with this?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: This what?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: This ATTACK. She looks at him calmly. Sadly.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. We’re done. She walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy SMASHING KID LOCO IN THE FACE with a flying drop-ki Kid Loco falls to the canvas. Randy struts around the ring, exhorting the crowd, soakin their cheers. Distracted, Randy doesn’t notice Kid Loco peeling himself the mat. Kid Loco sneaks up behind Randy and SMASHES HIM THE HEAD. Randy goes down. Kid Loco lifts Randy up. They’re both on their knees, che to-chest. Kid Loco steps to his feet, lifting Randy with Kid Loco tightens around Randy’s arms, arches his back, presses out his chest and... WHAM!! He and Randy fly with LATERAL DROP. Randy’s head hits the canvas hard as he sla down on his back. As Randy writhes on the mat, Kid Loco HEADS FOR THE TURNBUCKLE. RANDY'S POV: Kid Loco is untying the turnbuckle’s padded cover. Randy, clutching his back, discretely reaches into the waistband of his tights and pulls out a RAZOR BLADE. He t the blade between two fingers in his cupped palm.  16. Kid Loco heads back to Randy. He picks up him by the hair drags him to the turnbuckle, throwing him HEAD-FIRST into exposed metal post beneath. Randy, clutching his smashed head, discretely runs the bl along his hairline. No one sees it happen. BLOOD STREAMS DOWN Randy’s forehead. The crowd’s ELECTRIF Kid Loco slams Randy’s head into the metal post again. Ag Randy slumps over the corner ropes. Kid Loco cockily stru around the ring.

dialogues.speaker: KID LOCO
dialogues.text: Look at this loser! How pathetic. ANGLE ON Randy. The taunting stirs something in him. A lo comes over him, like he’s Bruce Banner about to become th Hulk. Kid Loco saunters back over to Randy. He grabs his head f another post smash, but HE CAN’T. Randy’s neck and arm muscles bulge. His neck veins pop like he’s suddenly supe charged. A look of FEAR comes over Kid Loco. He knows the tide is about to turn. Randy reaches over his shoulder and grabs Kid Loco by the hair. He pulls him in close.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (under breath) Let’s go home. Randy juts his hips back and bends over, gaining the leve he needs for a throw. Kid Loco shakes his head, begging n Randy straightens his legs, raises his lower back, and ya down on Kid Loco’s head. Kid Loco’s feet fly off the canv as his head gets BURIED INTO THE MAT. He gets stuck UPSID DOWN with his feet over the ropes. Randy, holding onto the top rope with both hands, thrusts knee into Kid Loco’s stomach. Again. Again. Kid Loco somehow manages to untangle himself from the rop He scurries away. Randy goes after him. Randy hits Kid Loco with everything he’s got. Dropkicks. Elbows. Bodyslams. He pours it on, unstoppable. Randy drags Kid Loco into the middle of the ring. He look out at the crowd.  17. RANDY'S POV: A trio of fans are chanting.

dialogues.speaker: TRIO
dialogues.text: Ram Jam! Ram Jam! Ram Jam!... Randy cups his hand to his ear. The chant quickly spreads

dialogues.speaker: RAM JAM
dialogues.text: Randy “mulls” it over. He looks at his laid-out foe. He l at the corner. He heads for the corner. Randy climbs to the top rope. He looks around at the crow like he’s still undecided. RANDY'S POV: The fans are cheering, wild with anticipatio Randy bends his arms, pressing them against the side of h head like ram’s horns. (Just like in the photo in the ope montage. ) He LEAPS. The leap is not terribly high or graceful. He crashes dow onto Kid Loco horns-first. Kid Loco’s whole body convulse The fans lose it. This is what they wanted. The Ram Jam. money shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, on a post-match high, sits on a cafeteria table enjoying a beer as a pseudo-MEDIC stitches up his hairlin gash. Nick Volpe wanders over.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: Ram, man, you popped that crowd. Randy smiles contentedly. He sure did.

dialogues.speaker: NICK VOLPE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yo, Ram. Got a sec? Nick Volpe comes over.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: For you, needledick? Always.

dialogues.speaker: NICK VOLPE
dialogues.text: Do you realize what’s coming up?  18. Randy looks at him, unsure. NICK VOLPE (CONT’D) May 6th... Randy racks his brains. He has no idea. NICK VOLPE (CONT’D) 20th anniversary of you and Ayatollah at the Garden.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (amazed) Holy shit...

dialogues.speaker: NICK VOLPE
dialogues.text: I know. Time fuckin’ flies. Randy sees an excited smile creep across Volpe’s face.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Whatcha thinkin’?

dialogues.speaker: NICK VOLPE
dialogues.text: Two words: Re. Match. Randy is instantly intrigued. NICK VOLPE (CONT’D) I'm doing a big Fanfest thing down in South Carolina that weekend. I wanna main-event it with you two.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: NICK VOLPE
dialogues.text: Ram-Ayatollah II. 20th anniversary. Hundreds, thousands of screaming fans watching you two make history for the second time.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Think Bob’d get back in there? He’s pretty retired.

dialogues.speaker: NICK VOLPE
dialogues.text: For this? (cool, confident nod) I bet he'd be willing to dust off the old turban.  19. Randy’s mouth is practically watering.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CHEETAH’S —- PARKING LOT - SHORT TIME LATER A spring in his hobbled step, Randy gets out of the van a heads toward Cheetah’s, the strip club he passed earlier. Manning the door is BIG CHRIS, a huge bouncer/doorman.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHRIS
dialogues.text: Whassup, Ram? How ya been?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yo, Big Chris. They chummily shake hands. Big Chris pulls Randy in tight

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHRIS
dialogues.text: (into Randy's ear) Hey, can you get me any more of that IGF-1?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What do I look like, some fuckin’ two-bit street dealer?

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHRIS
dialogues.text: C’mon, hook a brother up. You get the family discount.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Swing by the mansion. Any day this week.

dialogues.speaker: BIG CHRIS
dialogues.text: You da man, Ram! INT. CHEETAH’S —- SHORT TIME LATER MUSIC: BIRDMAN & LIL WAYNE - “STUNTIN’ LIKE MY DADDY” A crowded, not-very-glamorous Jersey strip club. Randy st over by the bar. The female BARTENDER slides him a beer.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Thanks, hon. Randy takes a swig, looking around the club.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cassidy around?  20.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: I think she’s VIP-in’. Randy, nodding, takes his beer and heads over toward the STAGE. He settles in at an open table.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: A YOUNG STRIPPER (22) works the pole, grinding lewdly to “Stuntin’ Like My Daddy”, a bass-heavy Dirty South rap so

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Randy, watching her, quickly grows bored. He finds the stripper, like the song, crude and soulless. INT. CHEETAH’S —- MEN’S ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER Randy is at the urinal. He flushes and heads over to the sink. He washes his hands, checking his look in the mirro He primps a little. INT. CHEETAH’S — MAIN ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Randy exits the bathroom and heads back toward the table. route, he passes a curtained-off VIP ROOM. WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) Trust me, babe. You’re gonna be happy. Randy, hearing this, slows.

dialogues.speaker: DUDE
dialogues.text: We said the other one.

dialogues.speaker: DUDE
dialogues.text: The redhead. With the belly chain. Randy peeks through the curtain. Inside, he sees CASSIDY (36), a sexy, tattooed, aging rocker chick in a white spa dress. With her are six hair-gelled, goombah-wannabe BACH PARTY DUDES (early 20s). The BACHELOR is sitting in a cha in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Sorry, guys, she’s on break.  21.

dialogues.speaker: DUDE
dialogues.text: Well, I’m sorry, but we don’t want you.

dialogues.speaker: DUDE
dialogues.text: How old are you, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: BACHELOR
dialogues.text: You're, like, my mom’s age. Stifled laughter from his buddies.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SIDE OF CURTAIN
dialogues.text: Randy's anger builds as he watches.

dialogues.speaker: VIP ROOM
dialogues.text: Cassidy, trying to salvage the gig, straddles the bachelo

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: There’s nothing like experience. (into his ear, seductive) I’ve done things your little fiancee’s never dreamed of...

dialogues.speaker: DUDE
dialogues.text: Yeah, like graduate in 1985. This cracks his friends up. Randy BURSTS THROUGH THE CURT

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (to Dude #2) Apologize to this lady. Everyone is taken aback, including Cassidy.

dialogues.speaker: DUDE
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You speak to her with respect. Cassidy wedges herself between Randy and Dude #2.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I got this. It’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: No, it’s not okay. This is definitely not okay.  22. He turns to the bachelor.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guarantee this woman’s 50 times hotter than whatever goombah skank you’re about to marry.

dialogues.speaker: DUDE
dialogues.text: (to Dude #1) You hear what he just called Gina?!

dialogues.speaker: DUDE
dialogues.text: That's my fuckin’ sister! Dude #1 steps to Randy, chest puffed out. Randy whips aro and GRABS THE CHAIR OUT FROM UNDER THE BACHELOR. He wield menacingly at Dude #1, who backpedals, terrified. Randy makes like he’s going to hit the guy with the chair Instead, he FLINGS IT AT THE WALL.

dialogues.speaker: DUDE
dialogues.text: Jesus!! What the FUCK!! The entire bachelor party rushes for the curtain. Just li that, they’re GONE. Randy looks at Cassidy, expecting a hearty thank you. Ins he gets a PISSED-OFF SHOVE.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot. That was 200 bucks just walked out. Randy is totally taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I was just trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Did I ask for help? (beat) Did I need help? Randy looks down, silent and sheepish. CASSIDY (CONT’D) Then don’t fuckin’ help.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You're right. I’m sorry. (beat) I’m sorry.  23. Cassidy calms down a little.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: That’s okay. She looks at him with a warm smile. CASSIDY (CONT’D) Good to see ya, man.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHEETAH’S —- SHORT TIME LATER MUSIC: KHIA - “MY NECK, MY BACK” Randy is getting a LAPDANCE from Cassidy. She plants her hands against the mirrored wall behind him, her body just inches from his face.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: We’re talking one of the historic matches in history. 20,000 people. Another million and a half watching at home on pay-per-view. She turns, giving him a nice view of her writhing behind. the small of her back is an AC/DC TATTOO.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We were going back and forth, just killin’ each other for a half hour. Any wrestling fan, they know all about it.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Million and a half? Shit.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was big. So a rematch... (smiles, contemplating the prospect) History all over again. Cassidy turns around again. Randy looks her body up and d savoring her curves as she dances just for him.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamn you are smokin’. Cassidy smiles a little. This makes her feel good.  24. “My Neck My Back” ENDS. Cassidy pulls back on her dress a casually sits down next to him. A new song comes on. MUSIC: PITBULL - “UNA MANO LAVA LA OTRA” They look toward the stage, where a PUERTO RICAN STRIPPER shakes her ass to the staccato, abrasive Latin rap song.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who knows. I put on a good show... Cassidy nods supportively, sincerely.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could be the thing that gets me back on top.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You never know who’s in that crowd. An ALARMED LOOK comes over Cassidy's face.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus. Randy follows her eyes to his HAIRLINE. CASSIDY (CONT’D) You're bleeding. A small amount of BLOOD is trickling down from his stitch He grabs a COCKTAIL NAPKIN and casually dabs it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Got cut tonight.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Ah, it’s nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (small chuckle) And they say wrestling’s fake. Randy proudly holds out his arm.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: How’s this for fake? CASSIDY’S POV: A long-ish SCAR on Randy’s bicep.  25.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: What’s that from?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: 1986. Denver Coliseum. Billy Bob Banjo hit me with his two-by-four. Loose nail tore the bicep open.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Ow. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I got even better. He pulls down his shirt collar, revealing a nasty COLLARB SCAR.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 1988. Orlando Arena. Mr. Magnificent tossed me out of the ring. Landed on my shoulder, clavicle snapped in half.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Doesn’t it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (blissful) Not when they’re going crazy for you... Cassidy stands up and straddles him, gazing soulfully at scar.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: “He was pierced for our transgressions, He was crushed for our iniquities. The punishment that brought us peace was upon Him, and by His wounds we were healed.” Randy contemplates the quote. He likes it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: It’s from “Passion of the Christ”. (beat) You never seen it? Randy shrugs no.  26. CASSIDY (CONT’D) Dude, you gotta. It’s amazing. She sits down next to him again. CASSIDY (CONT’D) It’s, like, so inspiring. They throw everything at Him. Whips, arrows, rocks... Just beat the living fuck out of Him for the whole two hours. And He just takes it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Huh. I’1l have to check it out. Cassidy lightly traces a finger along Randy’s bicep scar.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: The sacrificial Ram... The Pitbull song ends. A new song begins. MUSIC: MOTLEY CRUE - “GIRLS GIRLS GIRLS” CASSIDY (CONT’D) Ah, shit.

dialogues.speaker: CLUB D.J., (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And now, please welcome to the Cheetah's stage... Cassidy stands up.

dialogues.speaker: CLUB D.J., (0.S.)
dialogues.text: .--the lovely Cassidy! Randy reaches into a pocket and pulls out some bills.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What do I owe?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Just gimme for three. Randy peels off three $20s and hands them to her. CASSIDY (CONT’D) You’11 wait ‘til I’m done? Randy just smiles. She gives him a small peck on the chee and heads off.  27.

dialogues.speaker: THE STAGE
dialogues.text: Cassidy BURSTS ONTO THE STAGE. She owns it with rock ‘n’ energy.

dialogues.speaker: ON RANDY
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Randy’s face as he enjoys the dance.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. VAN —- DAY Randy is driving over the Throgs Neck Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls up to a TWO-FAMILY HOUSE in working-class Queens. Out steps Lex Lethal (from the Passaic VFW show).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy heads down a highway entrance ramp, Lex Lethal ridi shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL
dialogues.text: Thanks for the lift, bro.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: No prob. You're right on the way. Randy merges into traffic on the Long Island Expressway.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So how big’s this place?

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL
dialogues.text: Nice. Two, two-fifty... (beat) You been there. The Ricky Whipsaw memorial benefit.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (pleased) That place?

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL
dialogues.text: Should get a good gate. DiFusco says he’s gotten like 20 calls last two days alone.  28. Randy chuckles cynically.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: God bless hardcore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Long Island strip-mall 99-CENT STORE. Randy and Lex bro an aisle. Randy is holding a TIN CAKE PAN. He bangs it against his forehead, testing it out. It makes a LOUD CLA

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Whatcha think? Lex takes the pan, testing it against his own head.

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL
dialogues.text: Cookie trays were better. Lex spots something exciting on another shelf.

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah. He grabs a pack of STEEL-WOOL PADS. Randy nods in approva Lex tosses them into the SHOPPING BASKET Randy is holding ANGLE ON basket. It’s full of all sorts of “supplies”: co trays, lightbulbs, thumbtacks, cheese graters, wire hange cutlery sets, pizza cutters, etc.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Let’s see if they got extension cords. They head off in search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: AC/DC - “IF YOU WANT BLOOD (YOU GOT IT)” Randy stands BEHIND A CURTAIN as his entrance song plays. sneaks a peek through it. RANDY'S POV: A ROWDY CROWD of about 150 fills a COMMUNITY CENTER GYM. The vibe of the crowd is a bit rougher than previous events. A banner on the wall reads ECHW - EAST C HARDCORE WRESTLING. Pressed against the outside of the ri are a FOLDING TABLE and a 12-FOOT METAL LADDER.  29.

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: An ANNOUNCER stands with a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen...

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE CURTAIN
dialogues.text: Randy stands quiet and peaceful, head lowered slightly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: From Elizabeth, New Jersey, weighing in at 218 pounds... The former WWF superstar and wrestling legend... The one, the only... (beat) Randy “The Ram” Robinnnnsonnnnn!

dialogues.speaker: THE GYM
dialogues.text: Randy explodes into the gym, full of fire and showmanship He does a lap around the outside of the ring. His hand is raised high in the air, index finger and pinky curled int set of RAM’S HORNS. Fans do the same. Kids rush toward Randy, reaching out for HIGH FIVES. He obliges as many as he possibly can. Fans hold out FOLDING CHAIRS in front of him. (Just like the opening montage.) He “rams” each one with his forehea

dialogues.speaker: AC/DC
dialogues.text: If you want blood, You got it!/ If you want blood, You got it! He does a lap around the perimeter of the ring, enthusiastically head-butting chairs the whole way.

dialogues.speaker: AC/DC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Blood on the streets, Blood on the rocks/ Blood in the gutter, Every last drop/ If you want blood, you got it!! Randy climbs into the ring. He does a few neck rolls and bends, limbering up. The song fades down. A new song rises... MUSIC: CELTIC FROST - “DOMAIN OF DECAY”  30. Ugly, plodding HARDCORE DEATH METAL.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: And his opponent: From Hampton, Virginia, weighing in at 295 pounds... The boos begin to rain down. ANNOUNCER (CONT’D) Hellbilly Cannibaaaal! Through the curtain, HELLBILLY CANNIBAL emerges. A huge, overalls-clad, mangy, wild-eyed masochist. Crumbs cling t his scraggly beard. He’s dragging a heavy CANVAS SACK. A TEENAGER in the crowd holds up a sign reading HELLBILLY CANNIBAL SUCKS A FAT DICK. Hellbilly Cannibal climbs into the ring with his sack and folding chair. He heads to the center of the ring, where Randy awaits. They sit down on chairs facing each other. Under Hellbill Cannibal’s chair is his canvas sack. Under Randy’s is his Dollar Tree plastic shopping bag. Hellbilly Cannibal punches Randy. Randy punches Hellbilly Cannibal. They take turns punching each other, each shot little harder than the last. It’s like a violent game of “slaps”. After a stretch of this, Hellbilly Cannibal reaches into sack and pulls out a can of BUG SPRAY. He SPRAYS it in Randy's face. Randy falls off his chair. He staggers arou the ring clutching his face, howling in agony. Hellbilly Cannibal smashes the blinded Randy over the hea with his chair. Randy falls to his knees. Hellbilly Canni reaches into his sack and pulls out a FLUORESCENT LIGHT T Wielding it like a bat, he SMACKS RANDY in the face. The explodes with a pop. Grabbing a folding chair, Hellbilly Cannibal charges towa Randy. He takes a flying leap, riding the chair like a bo board. Just as he’s about to crash down on Randy, Randy R OUT OF THE WAY. Hellbilly Cannibal’s spine gets a violent jolt as the chair hits the mat. Randy reaches into his Dollar Tree bag and pulls out an aluminum COOKIE TRAY. He smacks Hellbilly Cannibal in the face with it. The tray makes an awesomely loud METALLIC CLANG. Randy hits him a bunch more times.  31. Randy is starting to get winded. His heart beats faster. He picks up Hellbilly Cannibal and flings him toward the ropes. Hellbilly Cannibal, bouncing off, ducks Randy’s awaiting forearm. He bounces off the opposite ropes and crashes into Randy knee-first. Hellbilly Cannibal grabs Randy by the hair and smashes hi face into the corner post. He scoops him up and FLIPS HIM OVER THE TOP ROPE, out of the ring. Randy LANDS HARD on t concrete floor. Hellbilly Cannibal hops out of the ring with the folding chair. He WHALES RANDY IN THE FACE with it. Randy stumble backwards toward the metal barricade between the ring and fans. Hellbilly Cannibal kicks him in the chest. Randy fl over the barricade, into the crowd. Fans scatter in an exhilarated panic. Hellbilly Cannibal throws Randy into a row of empty chair Randy goes sprawling. Chairs fly everywhere. Randy gets up. His heart is beating LOUD. FAST. Randy, dazed, heads toward the SNACK-BAR AREA. Hellbilly Cannibal follows after him. Randy grabs a metal GARBAGE C and WHIPS AROUND WITH IT, smacking Hellbilly Cannibal squ in the face. Hellbilly Cannibal goes down. Randy shakes out the can’s contents over Hellbilly Cannib showering him in trash. He shoves Hellbilly Cannibal’s he into the can and falls on it, ass-first. Randy grabs the ladder resting along the base of the ring POUNDS THE GARBAGE CAN with it, making an UNHOLY RACKET. With the can still over his head, Hellbilly Cannibal rise his feet. He HEADBUTTS RANDY with the can. Randy, stumbli around, gets headbutted again. Hellbilly Cannibal throws the can and drags Randy back to the ring by his hair, carrying the ladder in his other hand. Plopping Randy down on the mat, Hellbilly Cannibal sets u the ladder in the middle of the ring. He heads back out a grabs the folding table, setting it up by the ladder. He reaches into Randy’s Dollar Tree bag and pulls out a BOX THUMBTACKS. He scatters the tacks all over the table. Hellbilly Cannibal grabs Randy and pulls him up the ladde with him. They stand at the top, perched high above the table. Just as Hellbilly Cannibal is about to push off, R surprises him with a VICIOUS HEAD-BUTT. Hellbilly Canniba caught totally off guard. Randy headbutts him again. Rand grabs Hellbilly Cannibal and PUSHES OFF.  32. In mid-air, Randy does a 180 twist, causing Hellbilly Cannibal to CRASH THROUGH THE TABLE with Randy on top of Hellbilly Cannibal rolls around the mat in a daze, his ba bloodied and covered with tacks. He staggers to his feet. Randy hits him with a dropkick. Randy’s heartbeat is DEAFENING. All other sounds drop out Randy pulls Hellbilly Cannibal off the mat. As he gears u for another dropkick, his KNEES BUCKLE. A look comes over face. He DROPS TO HIS KNEES, one hand on the mat. Randy grabs his arm. He massages it. He FLOPS OVER, clutc his chest. He lies on his back gasping for breath, suckin the air. RANDY'S POV: The fans are unaware anything is wrong. They assume it’s part of the act. Hellbilly Cannibal sees a look of FEAR in Randy’s eyes. H knows this is real. He looks out at the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBILLY CANNIBAL
dialogues.text: Is there a doctor? Few fans look around. Most of them still think this is a Among those who sense it’s real is JERRY DIFUSCO, the eve promoter. He climbs into the ring. Kneels over Randy.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY DIFUSCO
dialogues.text: Randy. You okay? Randy is gasping. DiFusco turns to Hellbilly Cannibal.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY DIFUSCO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call 911. Lex Lethal and some of the other wrestlers climb into the ring. They huddle around Randy. JERRY DIFUSCO (CONT’D) Let’s get him up. With no small effort, they lift Randy. They carry him to ropes. They slow, unsure how best to get him through.

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL
dialogues.text: Put him down. They lower him to the mat. Lex hops out of the ring and g Randy’s ankles.  33. Several of the other guys hop out of the ring, supporting Randy’s underside as they carefully, awkwardly pull him o By now, the crowd realizes this is real. They surge forwa as DiFusco and the wrestlers carry Randy toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY DIFUSCO
dialogues.text: Get back, get back, get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is carried down a LONG HALLWAY, trailed by curious concerned fans. Lex is closest to Randy’s head.

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL
dialogues.text: You're okay, buddy. Hang on. They reach a door and enter. The wrestler holding Randy’s feet shuts it behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies on a table, his eyes rolling back in his head. squeezes his hand, trying to keep him conscious.

dialogues.speaker: LEX LETHAL
dialogues.text: Stay with us, bro. Help’s coming. EMS WORKERS come rushing in. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies unconscious. There’s a BREATHING TUBE in his m and ANOTHER TUBE going through his CHEST WALL. He’s hooke to a MECHANICAL VENTILATOR. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies asleep. The breathing tube is out. The chest t is still in. His eyes slowly open. He looks around, disoriented. Woozy Confused by all the wires on him, he starts PULLING THING OFF. Monitors BEEP. Nurses rush into the room, calming hi down as they try to reattach the wires.  34. He faints. INT. RANDY’S ROOM - NEXT DAY Randy, transferred to a regular hospital room, is watchin “All My Children” on the wall-mounted TV. The chest tube out, in its place a large bandage.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (slight Indian accent) Mr. Ramovic. Randy looks up. DR. TARACHANDANI (40) enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Call me Randy. The doctor, nodding, looks down Randy's folder.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So how we lookin’, doc?

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANI
dialogues.text: A lot better than before the bypass.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Great. So I’m all good. From the doctor’s face, it’s not quite that simple.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANT
dialogues.text: Your heart... You’re going to have to start taking much better care of it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Like...

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANI
dialogues.text: For starters, you must take your medication every day.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I could handle that.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANI
dialogues.text: No smoking. (Randy nods) And no cocaine.  35.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (defensive, offended) I don’t do coke.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANI
dialogues.text: It’s all over your blood work.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (sheepish, busted) Maybe once in a while.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANI
dialogues.text: Well, it has to be never. Randy gives him a reluctant nod. DR. TARACHANDANI (CONT’D) As for exercise, it’s still okay, as long as it’s moderate.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: So, like, wrestling...

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANI
dialogues.text: Not a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What if I do it moderate? I could hold back on certain moves. There’s always ways to fake—

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANI
dialogues.text: Mr. Ramovic...

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (edgy glare) Randy.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANI
dialogues.text: Randy, a man with your heart should not be flying around a ring crashing into people. Randy’s nostrils flare.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: With all due respect, Dr... (reads name tag, mispronouncing) ..-Trachanani, I'd like a second opinion on that.  36.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANI
dialogues.text: Of course. But I promise you, any doctor I showed your file would say the same thing. Randy lets out a skeptical, sarcastic snort. DR. TARACHANDANI (CONT’D) You almost died. The next time, you won't be so lucky.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I want a second opinion.

dialogues.speaker: DR. TARACHANDANI
dialogues.text: Your heart’s been through a lot. Even before the heart attack, it was significantly—

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I want a second opinion. (beat) I WANT A SECOND OPINION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is checking out of the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: ADMISSIONS-DESK WOMAN
dialogues.text: This is your copy. The ADMISSIONS-DESK WOMAN hands him some paperwork. He fo it up and stuffs it in a pocket. ADMISSIONS-DESK WOMAN (CONT’D) This was left for you. She hands him a plain white ENVELOPE. Randy opens it. Ins is a NOTE:

dialogues.speaker: PS... IF YOUR UP BY THE 23RD, I GOT SOMETHING IN YONKERS
dialogues.text: Randy looks into the envelope again and pulls out $300. He looks at the money, chuckling ironically. It’s his big payday in years. He tucks it in a pocket. ADMISSIONS-DESK WOMAN (CONT’D) You have somebody picking you up?  37.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy steps out of the hospital into the bright light of He squints, his eyes adjusting. He stands there looking around, a lost animal.

dialogues.speaker: TIME LATER
dialogues.text: A CAB pulls up to Randy’s van, still parked in the commun center's lot. Randy steps out of the cab and limps to the van. He gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits in the van in the otherwise empty lot, ponderi his next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy roams an aisle, killing time, idly browsing the selection of deodorants.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Robin Ramovic? Randy looks up. He heads down the aisle, toward the voice comes to the...

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACY COUNTER
dialogues.text: A female PHARMACIST stands holding a small pharmacy bag.

dialogues.speaker: PHARMACIST
dialogues.text: Robin Ramovic? Randy heads toward her. PHARMACIST (CONT’D) Is that you? He gives her a small, embarrassed nod, taking the bag.  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy hands Len the manager a bunch of cash. Len notices seems a little off.

dialogues.speaker: LEN THE MANAGER
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah. EXT. RANDY’S TRAILER - SHORT TIME LATER Len removes the padlock from Randy’s trailer door.

dialogues.speaker: LEN THE MANAGER
dialogues.text: Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A messy, junk-filled trailer. Randy stands at the kitchen counter with the CVS bag. He opens the bag and takes out FOUR PRESCRIPTION PILL BOTTLES. We catch a glimpse of the drug names on them: PLAVIX. COREG. LIPITOR, LISINOPRIL. He gazes at the patient name on all of them...

dialogues.speaker: RAMOVIC, ROBIN
dialogues.text: INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - BATHROOM - LATER Randy is taking a shower. On his chest is a SURGERY BANDA He soaps up, careful not to get the bandage wet. INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - LATER Randy collapses on the bed, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - DAY Randy lies on the bed, gazing off. Restless. Bored. Somet catches his eye.  39. RANDY'S POV: On the floor, in front of the TV, is an old NINTENDO VIDEOGAME SYSTEM. The game cartridge in the cons is WRESTLEJAM ‘88. EXT. RANDY’S TRAILER - SHORT TIME LATER Randy sticks his head out of his trailer. RANDY'S POV: In front of the opposite trailer, ADAM (8), of the kids he was play-wrestling with, is idly throwing tennis ball against a car.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yo, Adam! Adam turns and looks toward Randy.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wanna play Nintendo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Adam sit on the floor playing WrestleJam ‘88.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: Cyber-Randy is wrestling The Ayatollah at a packed Madiso Square Garden. The graphics are late-'80s crude. Randy flies all over the ring, devastating his foe with a series of acrobatic leaps and kicks and flips.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY AND ADAM
dialogues.text: Randy wears a look of intense concentration. Adam makes a scrunched-up face at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What’s that square?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What square?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That you’re hitting me with.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It's a folding chair.  40.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That’s a chair?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (pissy) Yes, it’s a chair. Randy grunts, annoyed. They play for a stretch in silence

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: This is old.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: 1988 ain’t old.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That was, like, 50 years before I was born.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Shut up and fight.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM'S MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (outside trailer) Ad-aam! Adam looks toward the window. Randy hits PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Coming! Adam turns back to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Ready? Adam nods yeah. Randy un-pauses. Play resumes.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: Cyber-Randy drops The Ayatollah with a knee to the chest. another. The Ayatollah GOES DOWN. Randy heads to a corner CLIMBS TO THE TOP ROPE. He raises his arms, sticking his elbows out, pressing his fists to the sides of his head to form a SET OF RAM’S HOR Randy JUMPS. He flies high in the air, soaring over the m and crashing down on The Ayatollah horns-first. He pins T Ayatollah as the ref counts to three for the victory. The crowd goes wild.  41.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY AND ADAM
dialogues.text: Randy does a little celebratory fist pump. He hits RESET.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: One more?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Don’t you wanna get even? I whipped your butt.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: That’s okay. Adam gets up and scampers out of the trailer. Randy, suddenly alone, looks at the TV. He gazes at the w on the screen:

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: He selects 1 PLAYER. A new match begins. Randy plays without much enthusiasm. After a few halfhearted kicks and punches, he TOSSES THE CONTROLLER ASIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, standing in the middle of the trailer, does a JUMP JACK. He does another. A few more. He feels himself getting winded. A little woozy. He sits down. He sits still, trying to slow his heart. He starts to CRY. Angry, bitter, frightened tears roll down his cheeks. INT. CHEETAH’S - NIGHT Randy enters the club. It’s crowded tonight. He looks aro for Cassidy. He spots her in a corner offering a CUSTOMER lapdance. The customer passes. She moves on. Randy heads over. She gives him a friendly little cheek p

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetie. You’re back soon.  42.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Ah, I was just in the neighborhood. Cassidy nods oh.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (“casual”) Hey, feel like maybe grabbing a burger? Cassidy finds the offer a little odd. This isn’t how they operate.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I'm working.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: How ‘bout later, then? She looks at him, puzzled. He seems off.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Can we talk for a sec?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Sure. What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Someplace more quiet. Randy glances toward the door. Cassidy, catching his drif looks at him, a little gravely.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Randy, I can’t leave with a customer. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I had a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Shit. When?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I needed to talk to somebody.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You can’t talk here?  43.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Just a couple minutes.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Randy, I don’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Please. Cassidy looks at him, torn. She sees the need, the fear i his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Where are you parked?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: In back. Another pause of hesitation from Cassidy. This is big.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Go to your car. I’1ll meet you out there in 15 minutes. EXT. CHEETAH’S - REAR PARKING LOT - 15 MINUTES LATER Randy sits in the van, staring at the club’s rear EMERGEN EXIT. Cassidy emerges, a jacket covering her dress. Randy waves. Spotting him, she comes over, climbing in the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Thanks. I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: That’s okay. She looks at his vulnerable expression. CASSIDY (CONT’D) I’m sorry. That’s fucked up, dude. Randy nods. CASSIDY (CONT’D) When was it?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Last week.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Feelin’ much better.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Good, good. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It was while I was wrestling. I collapsed in the ring.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Oh, man. That’s terrible.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was pretty fucked up. He chuckles, a little perversely.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell ya, though, it was a big hit with the fans. (amused grin) Promoter told me everybody was hanging around wondering if I was okay, they wound up buying up all of his T-shirts and shit. Whole merch table got cleaned out.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: That’s funny. Randy’s grin fades. His expression turns melancholy, fear

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Doctor says I can’t wrestle no more.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Damn. What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I don’t know what to do. If I can’t wrestle... He loses himself in some bleak thought.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: It just happened. You don’t have to figure everything out this second. Give yourself some time.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Time’s all I got. I just sit there all day...  45. He stares off bleakly again.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You really shouldn’t be alone right now. He turns to her, looking her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: That’s why I came to see you.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (a little unnerved) Randy... She looks at him with sympathy. CASSIDY (CONT’D) I feel bad what happened. But you and me... I can’t go there. Randy gives her a sour, disappointed look. CASSIDY (CONT’D) You should be with family now. You have a daughter, right? Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: We don’t really get along too good.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter. You need her.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (bitter chuckle) She don’t need me.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Everybody needs a father. Trust me. Randy shrugs, not so sure. Cassidy glances at the dashboa clock. CASSIDY (CONT’D) I’m sorry. I gotta get back in. She puts a sympathetic hand on his knee. CASSIDY (CONT’D) You take care of yourself. She gives him a peck on the cheek. He lingers there for a second. A weird, tentative moment.  CASSIDY (CONT’D) You gonna be okay? He nods, putting his brave face back on.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I’m Randy The Ram. I’ve taken bigger bumps than this.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I’m sure.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Maybe I’1l give my daughter a call.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You should.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Why the fuck not? I’m her father. A person only gets one father in this life.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Unless you’re adopted. 46. Cassidy laughs. She gives him a friendly pat on the shoul

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You're gonna be just fine.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Definitely. Cassidy climbs out of the van. Randy watches as she heads back into the club. His cheery expression fades. He is alone again.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - DAY Randy sits on his bed, sifting through a messy, junk-fill shoebox. He pulls out an OLD PHOTO. RANDY'S POV: It’s a mid-’80s photo of Randy and his infan daughter Stephanie in front of the family Christmas tree. Randy, wearing a Santa cap, is smiling and laughing, Stephanie perched on his huge, steroid-pumped bicep.  47. He flips the photo over. On the back are a bunch of scrib PHONE NUMBERS. They’re all crossed-out except the last on The numbers get progressively more faded from bottom to t as if they’ve been written down over the course of years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands at a PAY PHONE with the photo, ringing phone cradled to his ear. STEPHANIE’S VOICE This is Stephanie, you know what to do. (answering machine BEEP) Randy listens to the silence. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits in his van by the curb of a modest, lower-midd class house. He looks at the house, working up the nerve approach. EXT. STEPHANIE’S HOUSE - LATER Randy stands at the doorstep of the house. Steeling himse he rings the bell. A WOMAN (22) appears at the door in a SHIRT and PANTIES.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (a little thrown) Hey... Is Stephanie home? The woman looks at Randy a little coldly, sensing who he

dialogues.speaker: THE WOMAN
dialogues.text: Who can I say it is?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Her father. She disappears into the house. A few moments later, Stephanie emerges with a BACKPACK sl over her shoulder. In her hands is a TEXTBOOK. She heads straight down the driveway, blowing past Randy.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where you going? He goes after her.  48.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stephanie! He catches up. She stops.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Can we talk?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Now’s really not a good time. She resumes walking, briskly.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Wait! (chasing after her) Where ya going? He looks at the textbook in her hands: PRINCIPLES OF CHIL DEVELOPMENT.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You in school? That’s great. She turns DOWN THE SIDEWALK. He continues following.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What school? No answer.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What school?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Middlesex County Community.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Middlesex? That’s kind of a hike. Where’s your car? (no response) You taking the bus? Lemme give you a lift.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: That’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It’s no problem. (beat) Really. I’m parked right by.  49. Stephanie picks up the pace, trying to lose him.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're walking pretty fast there. You running late? (no answer) I could help you with that. (no answer) Give you a ride. She keeps right on walking.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: New Jersey Transit sucks! And walking.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The buses smell like piss! She fights off an amused smile. She slows a tiny bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is driving Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Left at the second stop sign.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am! Randy drives. He slows at the second stop sign, which is bigger, FOUR-LANE STREET. He makes the left. They drive f stretch in awkward silence. Randy seems a little nervous.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You gonna talk? A pause as Randy gathers his words.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: There’s something I wanted to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I had a heart attack. (beat) Last week.  50. He looks at her earnestly.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wanna try to fix things. Stephanie sits there in calm silence, processing all of t

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You are such an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (taken aback) Why?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Now you wanna fix things. Now that suddenly you’re all scared and alone from your heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What? No. It’s not like—

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: This is so fuckin’ you. You only come around when you need something from somebody, when they can do something for you. Selfish fuck. Good. Be alone. She suddenly OPENS HER DOOR as the van is moving. She HOP OUT. Randy hits the brakes, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Stephanie stumbles and falls. She gets up. Walks off in t direction they came from.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stephanie! She’s gone. He angrily punches the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy lies on his bed, gazing off depressedly. On his che is a well-worn DAY PLANNER, open to a marked-up page. ANGLE ON page. Scribbled in marker in one of the boxes is RAHWAY AUTOGRAF SHOW.  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, standing at a folding table in a gym, unzips a duf bag. He pulls out a stack of 8x10 GLOSSIES of himself. It high-flying, mid-air Ram Jam photo from the height of his ‘80s glory. He puts them on the table. Looks around the gym. RANDY'S POV: He’s at an AUTOGRAPH SHOW that hasn’t starte yet. Around the perimeter of the gym, TEN FOLDING TABLES set up. At each one, a BEAT-UP, WORN-OUT OLD WRESTLER is laying out his wares—8x1l0s, old match tapes, etc.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Didn't think I’d see you here. Randy looks up and sees Scott Brumberg, the promoter from beginning. He’s wearing the same “BRUMBERG - 44” Mets jer

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: Heard you collapsed at the DiFusco show. Sounded pretty scary. Randy smiles coyly. SCOTT BRUMBERG (CONT’D) What?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Sold the shit outta that one.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: No way!

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I gotta give credit. DiFusco came up with the idea. We’re setting up an angle for a grudge match.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: Wow... Dude, you are good. Randy gives a proud “Hey, what can I say?” shrug. SCOTT BRUMBERG (CONT’D) I was sure I’d have to cancel the minivan.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What minivan?  52.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: The one I rented for Fanfest. Randy looks at him, surprised. SCOTT BRUMBERG (CONT’D) Me and a whole gang’s driving down. Terry C., Caggiano, Fatback... I am so fuckin’ psyched. (beat) You see the flyer? Randy looks at him blankly. Brumberg walks over to a near table, where there’s a stack of BRIGHT-ORANGE FLYERS. (Th same flyer can be seen scattered around the room on chair the floor, etc.) He grabs one and brings it back over. SCOTT BRUMBERG (CONT’D) Volpe gave me an assload to pass out. He hands it to Brumberg. SCOTT BRUMBERG (CONT’D) That is gonna be epic. RANDY’S POV: The flyer.

dialogues.speaker: NICK VOLPE PRODUCTIONS PRESENTS
dialogues.text: *%4%* “LEGENDS OF THE RING” FANFEST ****

dialogues.speaker: MAY 6, 1988 WRESTLESLAM IV MATCH...
dialogues.text: RANDY “THE RAM" ROBINSON VS. THE AYATOLLAH

dialogues.speaker: ALSO SCHEDULED TO APPEAR
dialogues.text: EDDIE RUCKUS, THE MORTICIAN, DEAN “THE DREAM” GIGUNDA,

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Randy nods vaguely at the flyer, his feelings hard to rea

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Looks great.  53. Brumberg looks around the room as the wrestlers set up sh

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: Should get a pretty good crowd today. Randy holds up his hand, wiggling his fingers for Brumber

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I'll start loosening up. Brumberg walks off. Randy looks at the flyer again. A sou expression comes over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The signing is underway. FIVE OR SO FANS mill about the r drifting from table to table getting autographs and takin photos with the motley assortment of washed-up aging wrestlers.

dialogues.speaker: ON RANDY
dialogues.text: Randy is sitting behind his table, signing one of his 8xl for a FAN. He hands it to the guy, who hands Randy a $5 b

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You got it, broski. The fan walks off. Randy tucks the fiver into the FANNY P he’s wearing. There’s not much in there, just a meager fe ones and fives. Randy zips up the fanny pack. He looks up, ready to sign autographs—just as soon as somebody comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits at his table, bored. There are NO TAKERS. He l around the room at the other wrestlers. RANDY'S POV: One is asleep. Another looks borderline homeless. Across from him is a 40-SOMETHING WRESTLER in a WHEELCHAIR. Attached to his calf is a URINE BAG. A feeble stream of urine trickles into the bag.  54. Randy looks down at the stack of Randy The Ram 8x10s on t table. He gazes numbly at the high-flying image of himsel from 20 years earlier.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. Randy looks up and sees Brumberg. SCOTT BRUMBERG (CONT’D) I was sure the turnout’d be bigger. Randy shrugs resignedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pulls up to his trailer. He sits there with the eng idling, staring at his trailer, scared to go in alone. He pulls back out again.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHEETAH’S —- SHORT TIME LATER MUSIC - LIL’ KIM - “HOW MANY LICKS?” Cassidy, roaming the room, approaches a CUSTOMER sitting the stafe. She leans in to his ear, her hand on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Would you like a lapdance, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: That’s okay. Cassidy moves along. She approaches a PAIR OF GUYS. She l in to one of them.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Would you like a lapdance? GuY #1 Not right now. She looks toward the other guy. Before she can even ask:

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: I’m good. Cassidy heads off, rejected.  55.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. She turns and sees Randy. She’s happy to see him after th string of no’s.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Hey. How ya feeling?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Better. Good. She leads him over to a table. They sit.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: How'd it go with your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (unconvincing) Good. Fine.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Randy dodges her eye contact. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Not too good, actually. She tore me a new asshole.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Shit. That sucks. He nods dispiritedly. CASSIDY (CONT’D) It’s tough. You can’t give up. You gotta keep trying. Another half-hearted nod. A brief conversational lull.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I was thinking about maybe getting her a present.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: That’s a great idea! (beat) What’s she into?  56.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I’m not sure.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: How old is she?
(beat) 22.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: What kind of music does she like?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Is she into books? Cooking? Randy just looks at her blankly. CASSIDY (CONT’D) How could you not know? She’s your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I’m a shitty fuckin’ father. Cassidy, feeling bad, is hit with an urge to help.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: She’s 22? Okay... (riffing) You should get her some clothes, some kinda clothes... All girls like that.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: That could work.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I know the perfect place. This kick- ass little vintage shop in Westfield.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Saturday's the best time to go. That’s when they get the new stuff in, all these boxes full of great shit.  57.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Okay. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I'll write it down. Cassidy grabs a pen and a cocktail napkin off the bar. CASSIDY (CONT’D) I’m pretty sure it’s on 28. She scribbles down YESTERDAZE - WESTFIELD. Hands it to hi

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Good tip. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You got it. Cassidy starts dancing for him, as is their routine. Rand doesn’t seem into it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna grab a drink at the bar. Randy gets up and heads off toward the bar. She watches h go, feeling rejected. Cassidy gets up. CAMERA stays on her face as she does a l around the club. She glances back toward the bar. CASSIDY’S POV: Randy is sitting at bar. She scans the room. A CUSTOMER is looking her way. She st to approach. Then, she STOPS. She looks back toward Randy again. He’s sitting at the bar alone. She heads over to h He looks up from his drink.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was fast.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Listen... Cassidy pauses, hesitant. She takes the plunge: CASSIDY (CONT’D) How ‘bout I meet you there Saturday? Help you out.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah?  58.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (“casual”) I’m actually gonna be running around right in that area anyway, so it’s not really a pain.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: All right. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: No problem. You got it. She gives him a chummy arm tap and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy knocks on Wayne’s door.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah? INT. WAYNE’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Wayne looks up at Randy, mildly annoyed by the disruption his computer screen is an ONLINE POKER game.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Hey, Wayne. Got a sec?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Not really. What?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you had something more steady. Full-time.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Only thing I got right now’s got weekends.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: That works.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Isn't that when you sit on other dudes’ faces?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What is it?  59.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Deli counter. Randy seems a little hesitant.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: So, like, working with customers?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: All day long, hot horny housewives begging for your meat. (beat) And prepared salads. Randy thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: That's the only thing you got?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: At the moment. You interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands alone in front of YESTERDAZE, a strip-mall vintage clothing store. He looks at his watch, almost thinking of leaving.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Randy looks up. He seems slightly thrown by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Hey. RANDY'S POV: It’s his first time seeing Cassidy in street clothes and in daylight. She’s not wearing makeup, and he hair is pulled back in a ponytail. She’s also a good thre inches shorter out of her stripper heels. They shake hands, a bit awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I almost didn’t recognize you. You look all... clean.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: “Clean”?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Like classy.  60.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Gee, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Nah, nah, I don’t mean that bad. I like it. (beat) It’s like in “Grease”, where she turns into the hot rock ‘n’ roll chick at the end. Except backwards.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Oh-kaay... Randy looks at her sneakers, a far cry from the clear hee he’s used to.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: So, uh... Should I call you Cassidy or Pam? She gives the question genuine thought.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Pam. (playful finger wag) But don’t get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy follows Cassidy toward the back of the store. He lo around, taking in the array of funky ‘50s/'60s/'70s cloth

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: This is awesome... (rubs hands together, psyched) We are gonna find something great! Cassidy is less loose and playful than Randy, much more i business mode. They come to the back where, against the w she finds what she’s looking for: a bunch of CARDBOARD BO bursting with a wildly eclectic assortment of tops, skirt pants, etc. She starts sifting through.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Do you know her size?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: She's kinda skinny, a little shorter than you.  61. Cassidy spots a fun, multi-color MINI-SKIRT. She pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Could you see her in this?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Maybe. (beat) Not really. (beat) I’m not sure. Cassidy tosses it back in. She unearths a Flashdance-styl SWEATSHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: What about this? Randy makes a sour face. She tosses it back. CASSIDY (CONT’D) So like, what is she? Goth? Punk? Hippie? (beat) Preppy? Stoner? Randy ponders the choices.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Not really... Cassidy lets out a good-natured groan of frustration. Ran watches as she continues searching.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Pam?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Thank you very much. Cassidy looks at him. She can feel his sincere appreciati

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You’re welcome. She returns to searching. Sift, sift, sift, sift.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I think she might be a lesbian.  62. Cassidy stops sifting. She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Does that help? Cassidy leads Randy by the arm over to the...

dialogues.speaker: MEN'S AREA
dialogues.text: Cassidy heads to a RACK OF CLOTHES. She quickly zeroes in a RETRO BOWLING SHIRT. She holds it up to Randy, who make scrunched-up face.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Ah, maybe she’s just a friend. Cassidy puts the bowling shirt back. As she does, somethi catches Randy’s eye.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s that? (pointing) The green. Cassidy holds up the item for Randy.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (surprised) This? An excited look comes over Randy's face.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It’s perfect. RANDY'S POV: A satin-green ROLLER-DISCO JACKET. Embroider on the left breast is a big “S” in purple script. It’s UG Cassidy looks at the jacket. She clearly finds it awful. She looks at Randy, who’s beaming with excitement and pri She finds it very endearing.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterdaze bag in hand, Randy opens the door to his van. and tosses the bag inside. He’s on a post-shop high, miss accomplished.  63.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Thanks again.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You found it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I never woulda known about this place.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Okay, I’1l give you that. A tentative pause. Cassidy looks at him, ready to part wa CASSIDY (CONT’D) Look, I...

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Man, I worked up a pretty good thirst in there. What say we grab a beer?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I gotta get going.
