dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: One beer! We gotta re-hydrate! Cassidy seems torn.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I really can’t. (beat) I got a kid at home.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You have a kid? Cassidy nods. Yup.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had no idea. Cassidy shrugs casually.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Boy or girl?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Boy. Daniel.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: How old?  64.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Nine.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Wow... I had no friggin’ idea.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: It’s not something I usually tell customers. Not exactly a turn-on. Randy looks off at something by his van. An idea hits him

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Wait. He unlocks the door. Leaning into the van, he TEARS THE R THE RAM ACTION FIGURE OFF THE DASHBOARD. He proudly, excitedly holds it out to Cassidy.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now both our kids got something. She looks at the action figure, reluctant to take it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're gonna turn this down, too? Man, you’re rough! Cassidy chuckles a little. She takes it.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: That's very nice of you. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Tell him to take good care of that. $300 bucks on eBay.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Nah. Cassidy laughs a little. She can’t help but be charmed by sweetness and earnestness. After a pause...

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: One beer.  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Cassidy are having beers at the bar. He’s holdi her CELLPHONE, looking at PICTURES of her son. He moves o the next one.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: He’s a good-lookin’ kid.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I see where he gets it from. Cassidy smiles, flattered.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: He sure doesn’t get it from his douchebag father. Randy skips to the next pic. It’s a shot of an UNDER- CONSTRUCTION CONDO BUILDING.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Just this condo thing, down by Trenton.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You moving there?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Working on it. (beat) It’s a great area. Way cheaper. And the schools are awesome.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What about Cheetah’s?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I’m done. I’m quitting.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (a little disappointed) Oh. (nods to self) Okay... MUSIC: DEF LEPPARD - “POUR SOME SUGAR ON ME”  66. Randy's ears perk up at the song on the jukebox.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hell, yeah. He stands up, reaching out for Cassidy’s hand. She doesn’ give it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let’s dance.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: This isn’t a dance place.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Who cares? Fuckin’ Def Lep!

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (chuckles ) I've danced to this plenty.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Fine. Then I’m dancing for you. Randy starts DANCING in front of Cassidy, who’s sitting o barstool. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Is this a lapdance I’m getting? Randy goes into lapdance mode, “seductively” writhing for her, silly and self-aware.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Just sit back and enjoy. He turns around, wiggling his ass a little for her. He ru his hands up and down her sides. He drapes his long blond mane over her shoulders, running it over her face. She laughs, charmed and amused. He gazes into her eyes intensely.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The lapdancer has become the lapdanced. Cassidy laughs. He continues dancing, totally unembarrass  67.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I think we can get you a shift. Randy bobs his head along to the kick-ass Def Leppard tun really loving it. The song builds to its chorus. Randy SINGS ALONG.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Take a bottle, shake it up/ Break the bubble, break it u-up... (chorus ) Pour some sugar on me! In the name of love! Cassidy, unable to resist the call of the Lep, joins in.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY AND RANDY
dialogues.text: Pour some sugar on me! C'mon fire me up! (pointing at each other) Pour your sugar on me! I can't get enough... (eye contact, sultry) I'm hot, sticky sweet/ From my head to my feet yeah... From here, the song veers off into a GUITAR PART. Randy n along, savoring the awesome hair-metal riffing.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: They don’t make ‘em like they used to.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ eighties, man. Best shit ever.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Def Lep, Gunners...

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: The Criie...

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Then that Cobain pussy had to come around and ruin it all.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Like there’s something wrong with having a good time.  68.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ mopey douchebag. (beat) “Ooh, look at me! I wear flannel! I’m all depressed!”

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: “I'm from Seattle! I like rain!” Randy shakes his head sourly.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Nineties fuckin’ sucked.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: No shit... Their EYES MEET. A moment of CHEMISTRY. Mutual attraction Randy moves closer, his eyes locked on hers. He leans in for... a KISS. They MAKE OUT for a few seconds. Cassidy PULLS BACK. She gives Randy a playfully scolding FINGER WAG, masking fear and discomfort with what just happened. CASSIDY (CONT’D) No contact with the customers.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You're right. My bad. He keeps right on dancing, totally unaware of the shift t just occurred in her.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What’s up?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (glancing at watch) I totally didn’t realize the time.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: We just got here.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I should get home. She stands up. Randy is very disappointed.  69.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: C'mon. You said one beer! Randy points toward her ALMOST-FULL BEER on the bar. She picks it up and CHUGS the whole thing. She slaps the empt bottle on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Good night. She gives him an arm pat and walks out of the bar. Randy impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Randy’s first day of work. He slips into a DELI COAT Tucks his hair into a hairnet. Pulls a Shop-Rite baseball over the hairnet. He walks over to a mirror to see how he looks in his new uniform. He feels a little silly.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Here ya go. He turns and sees Wayne, who hands him something. Randy l at the item in his hand, vaguely bothered.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I thought it was gonna say Randy. ANGLE ON item, a Shop-Rite NAME TAG. The name on it is RO

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Guess they got it off your W-4.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Do I really even need to wear one?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Are you gonna be interacting with our valued Shop-Rite customers?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I—

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Then yes.  70.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Could they maybe re-do it?

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Just wear the fucking thing. Wayne walks off. Randy pins the name tag to his apron. He takes another look in the mirror, sighing unhappily. Randy looks up at the employee-room clock. It’s 8:59 AM. He heads toward a RUBBER-STRIP CURTAIN leading to the del counter. Standing before the curtain, he pauses a moment, gathering himself like before a wrestling match. He steps through. Showtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 10 CUSTOMERS hover in front of the deli counter wit Take-A-Number tickets. Randy, manning the counter, hands an OLD GUY in a WWII VETERAN baseball cap a packet of roast beef. The guy shuf off. Randy looks up at the Take-A-Number sign.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Seventeen. A WOMAN (60s) steps forward holding a 17 and a SHOP-RITE CIRCULAR. She carefully surveys the TURKEY-BREAST SELECTI in the case.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: The Hudson Acres, are they all on sale or just the regular? Randy looks clueless.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (holding up circular) It’s a little unclear. She hands the circular to Randy to take a look. RANDY'S POV: It says HUDSON ACRES TURKEY BREAST - $5.99/L He still has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd prefer the maple-glazed, but if it’s full price...  71. Randy briefly catches eyes with another customer, a BIG- HAIRED, SEMI-HOT PARTY CHICK in her forties. The kind of woman Randy would hit on in a bar. He dodges her eye cont embarrassed by the context.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (to circular lady) Hang on, let me... Randy picks up a phone behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into phone, over speakers) Wayne, please come to the deli counter. He cringes a bit as his voice booms over the store speake He hangs up and returns to the customer.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It‘ll just be a minute. The woman, nodding, looks into the deli case again.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Which in your opinion is the best smoked ham?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I guess it depends what you like.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: I tried the Apple Valley Farms once, and it was very salty. Do you find that? Randy steals a self-conscious glance at the party chick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Take-A-Number sign. It says NOW SERVING: 46.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Forty-six. A WOMAN (35) in workout clothes steps forward with a 46.

dialogues.speaker: WORKOUT WOMAN
dialogues.text: Could I get a half-pound of the pesto pasta salad?  72.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Sure. Randy grabs a plastic container.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pesto change-o. The woman smiles at Randy’s little offhand pasta pun. Thi pleases him. Randy scoops pesto pasta salad into the container. He put the container onto the scale. It reads .51 LB.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow. I am good. This gets Randy a small chuckle from the woman. Randy sla price tag on the container.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything else?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: Nope. That’s it. He hands her the container.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You have yourself a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: (friendly smile) I will. You, too. The woman heads off. Randy’s spirits are lifted by the exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy looks up at the Take-A-Number sign: NOW SERVING: 57
A HOUSEWIFE-TYPE steps forward with the number.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bingo! The housewife smiles.  73.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSEWIFE
dialogues.text: What’s my prize?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Anything in the case, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSEWIFE
dialogues.text: A pound of chopped liver and a half a pound of egg salad.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I think that can be arranged... He grabs a plastic container and throws it in the air, catching it behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephanie emerges from the Middlesex County Community Col building. A look of surprise comes over her face. STEPHANIE’S POV: Randy is standing there waiting for her his van. Under his arm is a LUMPILY WRAPPED PRESENT, no b

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: What are you, stalking me?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Do stalkers bring presents?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Well, I ain’t a stalker. But... He excitedly hands her the present. She looks at it waril

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Open it. She opens it. Inside is the green satin jacket. She holds up, trying to process.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The “S"” is for “Stephanie”.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. She looks at the jacket. It’s nothing she would ever wear  74.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I got it just for you.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I see that. What’s it for?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: No reason. Just because. Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I do. It’s... shiny. She looks at Randy. He is excited and proud.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I was looking in this store and saw it, and I just said, “That is it.” Stephanie nods, smiling politely.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what are you doing now?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: What am I doing?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Got any time? I was thinking we could swing by our old favorite spot.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: We have an old favorite spot?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You’1ll remember when you see. Whaddaya say?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Now’s not the best time. I’ve got some things to do.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What kinda things?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Stuff.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You ain’t got stuff! (beat) C’mon, give an old man a break.  75. He giver her his biggest, most charming puppy-dog smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Stephanie walk along the boardwalk. It’s a char little Jersey-shore boardwalk/beach lined with Skee-Ball games, ice-cream parlors, T-shirt shops etc. It’s a bit c and not very crowded, still out of season.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You really don’t remember?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Guess you were pretty young. They walk for a stretch in silence. He points to a spot.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There used to be this funhouse. (beat) The Monster Motel... Randy chuckles at the memory.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They had this cheesy-ass skeleton that popped out of a coffin. You'd get so scared, you’d cry. Then you'd beg to go in again.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: (chuckles to self) Always was a glutton for punishment.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You'd hop on my foot and wrap your arms around my leg. I’d have to walk you the whole way through like that.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I totally don’t remember.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (looks at her sweetly) I do.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Stephanie sit on a bench facing the ocean eatin mint-chocolate chip ice-cream cones. Randy is quiet and contemplative, not in his usual “on” mode. He takes a dee breath.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I accept your apology. She shoots him an irked look.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not like that. I just mean... You made amends. I free you. Her expression softens.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anything you've ever done or said or thought, I forgive. You’ve done nothing wrong to me. And anything I've ever done... (beat) I’m sorry. Truly. Stephanie is surprised by his emotion and sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I was young. My career was booming. All those lights, the fans, the crazy shit on the road... I wasn’t thinking about my kid. Or my wife. Stephanie nods.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My priorities were all fucked up. I know that. But now... I wanna try to make things right. I wanna try to get to know you. (lump in throat) I just hope it’s not too late. Randy gazes off at the ocean, filled with fear and love a regret. A tear starts to gather in his eye. He wipes it a before it has a chance to form. Stephanie looks at him, moved.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy and Stephanie play Skee-Ball side-by-side, father a daughter. EXT. STEPHANIE’S HOUSE - SHORT TIME LATER Randy stands with Stephanie in front of her house, droppi her off.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Hope that wasn’t too painful.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: It was okay.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Well... Randy, unsure what to do, extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bye. They shake. He pulls her in for a brief, mechanical hug.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Bye. Another pause.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: So... How about dinner sometime?

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Dinner?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Maybe Tuesday? Stephanie thinks it over.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (nodding, “casual”) Or not. That’s cool, whatever...

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Wednesday would work better. Randy is surprised and happy.  INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - LATER Randy sticks the old Christmas photo of Stephanie and him on the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands at the pay phone, ringing phone to his ear. his hands is his day planner, open to a page marked up wi upcoming gigs.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yo, Miggy. Ram. How ya doin’? (beat) Good, good. (beat) Listen, you’re gonna have to count me out for Utica. (momentous pause) I'm retiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another call.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Hey, how ya doin’, Frank? (beat) Good, good. Listen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another call. Randy is holding the Fanfest flyer.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Volp. You know I’d kill to do it. (beat) I realize. I understand. (beat) No more. I’m done. I’m retired. (beat) Positive. It’s time to move on. INT. CHEETAH’S - NIGHT MUSIC: WARRANT - “CHERRY PIE”  79. Cassidy is up on stage, doing her thing for a sizable cro She slinks up to a customer who’s holding out a dollar bi for her. She pulls on her G-string band, snapping it shut the bill. She moves over to another customer holding out a dollar a does the same.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. Over here. She looks toward the voice, coming from another side of t stage. CASSIDY’S POV: Standing there is Randy, holding out a PUR ENVELOPE. He looks toward her G-string, like he wants to it in like a dollar bill. She takes it with her hand instead. INT. CHEETAH’S —- SHORT TIME LATER Randy and Cassidy sit together at a table. Cassidy is hol the purple envelope, looking a little uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I'll do it later when it’s quiet.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I wanna watch. Reluctantly, Cassidy opens it. Inside is a GREETING CARD. CASSIDY’S POV: On the card’s front, a cartoon monkey is holding a big bunch of bananas. Across the top, it says

dialogues.speaker: THANKS A BUNCH
dialogues.text: Randy watches excitedly as she reads the inside. She puts it down after reading it.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: That’s very sweet. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Thank you. I couldn’t’ve done it without you.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I’m glad I could help.  80.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It was fun, right? We had a good time. She nods politely, reservedly, clearly trying to pull bac

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (fishing) Shopping... Another guarded nod.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, you ever been to Mother Kelly's?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: On 46?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: They got this kick-ass cover band Tuesday nights. Play anything you can think of. What do you say we—

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Randy.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I can’t do this.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (“you and me” gesture) This. Randy is confused and disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I thought we had a little something going here.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I think you’re awesome. You’re a great guy.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You think I’m, like, this stripper, but I’m not. I’m a mom, with responsibilities. I don’t think you wanna get with that.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What if I do?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I can’t go there.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What about the other day?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: That was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Why? How?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: The club and the real world, they can’t mix.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What if we’d met someplace else?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: We didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: But what if we did?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: We didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What if we did?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: We didn't.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You say I don’t know you, but you won’t let me get to know you.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You're a customer. You're just a fucking customer. That’s it. Okay? Got it? A long, wounded pause from Randy.  82.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) I got it. He takes a $20 out of his pocket, holding it out to her.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: What’s that for?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: A lapdance. He slides it across the bar to her. She slides it back.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're refusing a customer? He slides the $20 back to her.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gimme a lapdance. She slides it back again.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Am I a customer or not? He waves the $20 tauntingly in her face. She pushes it aw

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What’s the matter? (no answer) Not in the mood? (no answer) So fake it. I’m just a stupid customer. He tauntingly dangles the $20 in front of her again.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t mean anything. She looks away, trying to ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, give the customer a lapdance. Shake your tits. Smile.  83.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Pretend you like him.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I want a lapdance. She SWATS HIS HAND. The $20 falls to the floor. He picks up and SLAMS IT on the bar. RANDY (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: I WANT A LAPDANCE
dialogues.text: People turn and stare. Randy storms out of the club, humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 10 CUSTOMERS hover in front of the DELI COUNTER clutching Take-A-Number tickets. Randy, manning the count with a COWORKER, hands a WOMAN a packet of roast beef.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Can I help who’s next? An OLD LADY steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: OLD LADY
dialogues.text: Pound of German potato salad, please. Randy grabs a container and starts scooping potato salad. puts the container on the scale. It reads 1.06 LB. OLD LADY (CONT’D) A little less. Randy scoops out a little and weighs it again. The scale reads .96 LB. OLD LADY (CONT’D) A little more. Randy puts a little more in. The scale reads 1.03.  84. OLD LADY (CONT’D) A little less. Randy, trying to contain his aggravation, takes a tiny bi out. The scale reads 1.00. The lady nods in approval. Randy slaps a price sticker on the container and hands it across the counter.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Have a nice day. She shuffles off with her potato salad.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I help who’s next? A BLUE-COLLAR GUY (40s) steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: Yeah, could I get a... The guy does a DOUBLE-TAKE, noticing Randy's face. CUSTOMER (CONT’D) Do I know you from somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. The guy studies Randy’s face, trying hard to place it.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: You look so damn familiar. (racking his brain) You Teamsters?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Sorry, man. What can I getcha?

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: Half pound of Virginia ham and a half pound of the Jarlsberg. Randy reaches into the case and pulls out a ham. He bring over to the slicer, his back turned away from the guy. CUSTOMER (0.S.) (CONT’D) I know we've met someplace. Slice, slice, slice, slice... CUSTOMER (0.S.) (CONT’D) You play softball?  85.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Nah. Slice, slice, slice, slice...

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're not one of Mikey Bosch’s buddies, are you? Randy, shaking his head no, brings the sliced ham over to weigh scale. The guy SNAPS HIS FINGERS. CUSTOMER (CONT’D) Wait a sec. He looks at Randy, surprised and amazed. CUSTOMER (CONT’D) Randy The Ram? Randy stands there frozen.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: The old wrestler. From the ‘80s. Randy, shrugging blankly, wraps up the ham and slaps a pr sticker on. CUSTOMER (CONT’D) (forms Ram horns) Ram Jam! Randy grabs the Jarlsberg from the case and brings it ove the slicer. He starts slicing. CUSTOMER (0.S.) (CONT’D) Wow, that’s freaky. You look just like the dude. Except older. ANGLE ON the block of cheese as Randy slices. There’s onl SMALL CHUNK left. The chunk dwindles, getting smaller and smaller. The cheese separating Randy’s fingers from the b grows thin. He almost seems tempted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - LATE NIGHT Randy, unable to sleep, sits shirtless on the couch, star blankly at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: ON TV
dialogues.text: An NBA HIGHLIGHT CLIP of a FEROCIOUS DUNK. The crowd goes wild. The player roars as he runs back up court, full of macho swagger.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Randy’s eyes drift downward toward his chest. He gazes at still-fresh scar. Touches it tenderly. He takes a big swig of wine, polishing off a bottle. He p a cassette into the BOOMBOX on the floor. GUNS ‘N’ ROSES USE YOUR ILLUSION II. Randy cranks up the volume and hits PLAY... MUSIC: GUNS ‘N’ ROSES - “GET IN THE RING” The song begins with the sound of a ROARING STADIUM CROWD chant begins:

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (ON THE SONG)
dialogues.text: Guns! And! Roses!... Guns! And! Roses!... Randy starts to prowl the floor like it’s a wrestling rin before a match. He waves his arms, exhorting the crowd on song as if their cheers are for him.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (cups hand to ear) What’s that? Randy works the crowd. He points at a fan in the back row Flexes theatrically. Bangs his head on pretend chairs. Randy grabs the top rope and gives it a hard shake. Loose up with some neck rolls and trunk twists, he heads to the center of the ring.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (announcer-like) Folks, we are ready to rumble... The song, which starts with a slow, bluesy guitar intro, kicks in. FAST, RAGING HARD ROCK.  87. Randy stares down his invisible opponent. The opponent SU PUNCHES him. Randy drops to the ground. Randy lies on the floor getting kicked and punched. He kn his opponent down with a LEG SWEEP and pops up. Randy hits his opponent with a flurry of backhand chops.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen such determination! Randy immobilizes his opponent in some sort of headlock.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sleeper claw! Randy flips his opponent upside down, his head between hi knees. He drops him headfirst onto the bed/mat.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Piledriver! (beat) Just listen to this place! Randy scoops up his opponent again and SLAMS HIM TO THE M with another fancy move.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Powerbomb! The song reaches its frenzied, chant-like CHORUS: GUNS ‘N’ ROSES Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Randy joins in, pumping his fist.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Get in the ring! Get in the ring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strip-mall sports-card/comic-book shop. Tacked to the w by the entrance are FLYERS for various events—card shows, autograph signings, etc. Behind the counter is promoter Scott Brumberg, scarfing d a sloppy Subway sub. The door opens. He looks up, smiling  88.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: Ram! Randy heads over and gives him a warm hello handclasp.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yo, Brummy. Brumberg pulls him in for a hug.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: How's tricks? Good to see ya, man.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, good, good.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: So what brings ya by?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Well... I was thinking about maybe doing a reffing gig.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: I thought you’re retired.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: No wrestling, just reffing. Thought it might be fun. Shits ‘n’ giggles. Brumberg, nodding, reaches down and grabs out a beat-up SPIRAL NOTEBOOK with old event flyers sticking out.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT BRUMBERG
dialogues.text: See what we got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-school cafeteria. Randy is slipping into a REFEREE UNIFORM. Along the wall hangs a vinyl banner reading CAPW CONNECTICUT ALL-PRO WRESTLING.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER D, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Randy The Ref! Randy looks up and sees BOOKER D (30s), a big, black wres in FULL PIMP REGALIA. Though not a pro like Randy, he’s u tier indie circuit. Randy gives him a grin and handshake.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: ‘Sup, bro?  89.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER D
dialogues.text: Me and McPride was going over spots. We got this dope idea how to work you in.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I really ain’t lookin’ to mix it up tonight.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER D
dialogues.text: You're gonna love this. Check it out. So McPride—

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: That’s okay. You guys do your thing. Booker D looks at him, surprised and puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booker D lands on opponent SHAWN MCPRIDE with a BIG SUPLE He falls on top of McPride for the pin. Randy The Ref sma the mat, counting.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: One!... Twol... McPride kicks out. Booker D lifts up McPride. He hits him with a CHEST CHOP, sending him stumbling backwards into t ropes. Booker D goes after him. CAMERA STAYS ON RANDY'S FACE as he watches them wrestle o screen. Randy's eyes are glued to the action... Punches. Kicks. Suplexes. Bodyslams. The crowd is going crazy. He is tempted. Salivating almost. More punches. More cheers. Bodies crash loudly against th mat. Randy’s temptation grows with each shot. He can’t re any longer. He... JUMPS IN. Randy pushes Booker D out of the way. He’s SMASHED IN THE FACE by a McPride-swung folding chair meant for Booker D.  90. Randy goes down. A TRACE OF A SMILE is visible on his fac

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BOYS’ LOCKER ROOM - SHOWER AREA -— POST-MATCH Randy, Booker D, and McPride are SHOWERING in the open sh area. They’re on a post-match high.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER D
dialogues.text: What a screwjob.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN MCPRIDE
dialogues.text: Crowd was pissed. McPride gives Randy a “We're not worthy” bow of respect. SHAWN MCPRIDE (CONT’D) The master.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER D
dialogues.text: (wags finger, grins) Just reffing, my ass. I knew you'd get in there. Randy gives him a “Hey, what can I say?” shrug.

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN MCPRIDE
dialogues.text: Y'all feel like grabbing a drink? McPride and Booker D both look toward Randy. He’s the one they’re interested in hanging with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hotel bar, lively and hopping with a weekend crowd. Ran sits at the bar, holding court with Booker D and McPride. They're all well on their way to being drunk.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: By the time Ruckus fixes the tire, we've had so many Nyquil coladas we don’t even realize we missed the damn gig! Booker D and McPride CRACK UP.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Swear to God. Can’t make stuff like that up.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER D
dialogues.text: Yo, tell McPride shit-pit!

dialogues.speaker: SHAWN MCPRIDE
dialogues.text: Shit pit?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You never heard that one? McPride looks at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, man, fuckin’ classic. (beat) 1990. Nashville Coliseum, Rage In The Cage II. I’m in the locker room shaving when behind me the stall door opens. I turn and there’s Chris Columbo on the can taking a dump. He goes, “This is for Petrov”, fuckin’ wipes his ass, takes the shit-covered toilet paper and rubs it in his armpit. Five minutes later, he’s in the ring with Petrov in a headlock, poor Petrov stuck there in CC’s pit lookin’ like he’s gonna puke! McPride and Booker D roar with delight.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER D
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ classic. Randy beams proudly. BOOKER D (0.S.) (CONT’D) Uh-oh... Booker D spots something intriguing by the bar entrance. Randy and McPride follow his gaze there. RANDY'S POV: TWO WOMEN—late 30s, frosted hair, tight deni miniskirts—Jjust walked in the bar. He catches the twosom stealing a glance in their direction.

dialogues.speaker: BOOKER D, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ring rats, 12 o'clock. Randy and McPride seem to agree with his assessment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: BLACK CROWES - “HARD TO HANDLE”  92. The wrestlers are dancing with the women, MELISSA and ALY on the bar’s dance floor. Melissa is sandwiched between Booker D and McPride, shaking her ass for them like a 19- old spring breaker. Alyssa is paired off with Randy, grinding her him. She turns, facing him. Looks at him with

dialogues.speaker: ALYSSA
dialogues.text: I know who you are. She slowly runs her hands up Randy’s sides.

dialogues.speaker: ALYSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My brother used to have your poster on his door. Randy smiles, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Dude’s got taste. ass against a coy smile. Alyssa notices something intriguing over Randy’s shoulder Randy turns to see what she’s looking at. RANDY'S POV: Standing by the bar is a MAN. He turns back to Alyssa.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who’s that?

dialogues.speaker: ALYSSA
dialogues.text: A.J. My old coke dealer. Randy nods oh. A slightly weird moment between them.

dialogues.speaker: ALYSSA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t do that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Me neither. They exchange a look. INT. WOMEN’S BATHROOM - SHORT TIME LATER

dialogues.speaker: HARD CUT TO
dialogues.text: A single-person bathroom. Randy and Alyssa are doing BUMP COKE.  93. INT. WOMEN’S BATHROOM - SHORT TIME LATER Randy is FUCKING Alyssa from behind over the bathroom sin Alyssa MOANS LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: ALYSSA
dialogues.text: Oh, Gawddd... There’s a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through door) Could you please fuck someplace else? I gotta piss.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK SCREEN.
dialogues.text: RANDY'S POV: His eyes slowly open. Staring down at him fr white stucco ceiling is a poster of a HUNKY, SHIRTLESS FIREMAN with a pair of suspenders stretched across his oi up six pack. Across the bottom it says FIVE-ALARM FIRE. Randy looks around, disoriented. He is NAKED in a strange in a strange bedroom. His clothes lie on the floor next t LARGE GLASS BONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, wearing only a pair of bikini briefs, staggers int the KITCHEN. A ROOMMATE (23) in a Tweety Bird nightshirt pouring herself a bowl of Honey Nut Cheerios. She looks a Randy with a casual “wassup” head-nod.

dialogues.speaker: ROOMMATE
dialogues.text: Alyssa’s in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy emerges from Alyssa’s building in the previous nigh clothes, squinting at the blinding sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy enters his trailer, chuckling amusedly. He tosses h keys on the table. He heads over to the fridge and grabs a beer. As he close the fridge, his expression changes. A look of DEEP DISMAY comes over his face.  94. RANDY'S POV: The old photo of him and Stephanie on the fr door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. STEPHANIE’S HOUSE - SHORT TIME LATER Randy rings the bell. Stephanie’s “friend” answers the do

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Hey. She stares at him coldly and unnervingly.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is Stephanie home? She goes into the house, closing the door behind her. Ran stands there awkwardly, unsure what that meant. He thinks about knocking but doesn’t. He carefully turns knob, leaning into the house. From somewhere inside, he h the MUFFLED SOUND of Stephanie and The Friend talking. INT. STEPHANIE’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Stephanie and The Friend are arguing in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRIEND
dialogues.text: You don’t have to go out there. You don’t owe him shit.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRIEND
dialogues.text: Then why would you even— (looks up toward front door) Who said you could come in? THE FRIEND'’S/STEPHANIE’S POV: Standing there is Randy, g guiltily at Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Please leave my house.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I’m so, so sorry. I completely, totally—  95.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRIEND
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: (to The Friend) I can handle this.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRIEND
dialogues.text: Obviously not.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: (teeth gritted) I can handle this, Jen. The Friend, disgusted, grabs her coat and STORMS OFF out front door. Randy and Stephanie are alone. She glares at him for what feels like a long time.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're such a fucking asshole.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I feel horrible.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I waited in that restaurant two hours. Two fucking hours. Just in case you showed up late. “Maybe he got stuck in traffic. Maybe I got the time wrong”... (beat) Nope.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I know I fucked up. I fucked up bad.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You didn’t fuck up. You are a fuck- up. A walking, living, breathing fuck-up.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I’m trying to change. Really. I can’t stand when I—

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Just please shut the fuck up. Because I can’t even stand the sound of your voice. (seething) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought about having a drink for the first time in 11 months last night. That's what you do to me. (beat) You asshole! She grabs a SMALL POTTED PLANT off the table and THROWS I HIM. It NARROWLY MISSES HIS HEAD, exploding against the w

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucking piece-of-shit asshole! She grabs a CAN OF SODA off the same table and THROWS IT. NAILS HIM IN THE THIGH, exploding open on the floor. Soda sprays everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Jesus! Stop! She looks around, half-crazed, searching for something el to throw. He rushes toward her, wrapping her up in his ar

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Get off me!

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Calm down! He SQUEEZES TIGHTER. She THRASHES AROUND, fighting it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Calm down!

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: (thrashing violently)

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You don’t mean that!

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: YOU DON’T MEAN IT! Suddenly, she STOPS RESISTING. A STRANGE AND UNEXPECTED C washes over her.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I don’t mean it?  97. She is silent and still.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're right. I don’t. She shakes her head, placidly gazing off.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know why I got so hysterical. There’s no reason. I don’t hate you. I don’t love you. I don't like you. I was stupid to think you could change.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I can change.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: I don’t care.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I know I can.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: Doesn’t matter. I don’t care. I’m done. (beat) No more fixing it. It’s broke. Permanently. I’m cool with it. It’s better that way. She turns and looks him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t want to ever see you again. I don’t wanna see you, I don’t want to hear you... (beat) Done. You understand? Randy doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Actually, I don’t care if you understand. She walks toward the front door. Opens it wide.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goodbye.  98. EXT. STEPHANIE’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Randy steps out the front door. Stephanie’s cellphone rin She looks at the caller ID and picks up.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHANIE
dialogues.text: You can come home. (beat) He’s gone. She closes the door on him, disappearing inside the house Randy stands there alone on his daughter’s front step. Un what to do. He starts to CRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Take-A-Number sign. It reads NOW SERVING: 54 A crowd of AGGRAVATED CUSTOMERS stand waiting at the coun A FAT GUY in a motorized cart clutching a 71 throws a fel customer a “Do you believe these morons?” eye roll. Behind the counter are Randy and a COWORKER. Randy is put a block of Havarti onto the slicer. He moves lackadaisica distractedly. Wayne, noticing as he roams past, heads over.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Let’s pick it up. Rush hour. Wayne gives him TWO QUICK CLAPS and walks off. Randy adju the machine’s setting and begins to slice. He isn’t movin much faster.

dialogues.speaker: CUSTOMER
dialogues.text: While we're young... Any year now... Randy keeps right on slicing at his unhurried pace. He ge in a nice, meditative groove. Slice, slice, slice, slice, slice... He watches as his thumb inches closer to the spinning bla He stares at his thumb. At the blade. His thumb. He JAMS HIS THUMB INTO THE BLADE. Blood squirts everywhere. On his coat. On the deli meat.  99. Randy stares at the DEEP GASH, watching as blood pulses o in crimson surges. He smiles strangely at it. A customer GASPS. A commotion quickly spreads. WAYNE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Randy! Randy turns and sees a shocked Wayne rushing toward him. Wayne takes Randy’s arm and tries to lead him into the ba out of view.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (conscious of customers watching) Let’s get that patched up. Randy roughly SHOVES him away. Wayne stumbles backwards. Randy, turning toward the onlookers, raises his thumb to face. He dramatically smears the BLOOD ACROSS HIS MOUTH. Customers GASP. A woman SHRIEKS. Randy drags the gash across his cheek. He SMEARS A LINE O under each eye like WARPAINT.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (striking wrestling pose) Let’s get it onnn!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: Somebody call the cops! Randy ROARS at Wayne. Wayne JUMPS BACK, frightened. Randy rumbles out of the deli area LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERMARKET AISLE
dialogues.text: Randy dashes down an aisle. He dodges a WOMAN PUSHING A SHOPPING CART, purposely “over-dodging” her so he CRASHES INTO THE SHELVES and sends stuff flying. He dodges ANOTHE SHOPPER, dramatically crashing into the shelves again.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT REGISTER AREA
dialogues.text: Randy charges past the CASHIERS, out of the supermarket.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy sits in the van in the Shop-Rite parking lot. He ga at himself in the rear-view mirror, dried blood caked on face. He likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is on the pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Nick. Randy The Ram... (beat) I wanna do it. (beat) Fanfest. (beat) I know, but I want back in. (beat) So call Bob, get the match back on. (beat) Pay me? Don’t worry. Just cover my expenses. And pay Bob. Make sure he’s there. (beat) I don’t give a shit. I just wanna wrestle. INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - DAY Randy is digging through a pile of clothes in a closet. H pulls out his WRESTLING TIGHTS. INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - BATHROOM - LATER Randy, wearing rubber gloves and a towel around his neck, combs PEROXIDE through his hair. INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - BATHROOM - LATER Randy is SHAVING HIS CHEST. The hair has grown in since h last wrestled.  101. INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - LATER Randy stands in the middle of the trailer in just a pair bikini briefs. In his hands is a product called TAN IN A He gives the can a good shake and starts spraying his bod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy puts a snacks-and-soda-filled plastic bag in the fr of the van. He is surprised to see Cassidy pull up in her car. She gets out.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: How'd you find me?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Big Chris. Cheetah’s bouncer. Randy nods oh. CASSIDY (CONT’D) Look, I’m sorry if I came off like a bitch. I didn’t mean that stuff I said. You’re not just a customer. Randy nods. He heads toward his trailer. Cassidy follows. CASSIDY (CONT’D) I’m sure it seems retarded, but I gotta keep that line. It’s how I've been able to live with myself the last 12 years. INT. RANDY’S TRAILER - CONTINUOUS Randy enters the trailer, Cassidy close behind.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: There’s a place I’m trying to get to in my life. For me and my son. Randy heads to his wheelie bag, open on the bed. CASSIDY (CONT’D) I'm leaving that world behind. And I can’t bring anybody with me who—  102.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (doesn’t really care) Good for you. Quitting’s hard. He zips up his bag. Walks outside toward his van. She follows.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Where are you going? EXT. RANDY’S TRAILER - CONTINUOUS He gets in the van.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Got a match. He grabs the Fanfest flyer off the passenger seat and han it to her.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See ya later. He DRIVES OFF. She watches him go, the van kicking up dus its wake. She looks at flier. A look of concern comes over her face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC: SKID ROW - “I REMEMBER YOU” Randy is driving south on the New Jersey Turnpike. INT. CASSIDY’S APARTMENT - CONTINUOUS Cassidy grabs her purse and car keys off the kitchen tabl

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: In bed by 11. Don’t let him bargain. The BABYSITTER (15) nods at the instructions. Cassidy hea toward the...

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Bye, monkey...  103. She is struck by what she sees. CASSIDY’S POV: DANIEL (9) is on the floor, playing with t Randy The Ram doll. She watches as he makes the Randy doll climb up the couch armrest. The doll takes a FLYING LEAP off the couch, onto STAR WARS FIGURE laid out on the floor below. Daniel make EXPLOSION SOUND as Randy slams down on his foe. Cassidy looks at the doll, worried. INT. CHEETAH’S - LATER MUSIC: WARRANT - “CHERRY PIE” Cassidy is dancing onstage. She has a distracted, faraway look in her eye. She abruptly WALKS OFF mid-song. She heads toward the dressing room, disappearing through curtain.

dialogues.speaker: CLUB D.J., (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Cassidy—where ya goin’, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy unlocks her locker. She throws everything in it i a duffel bag. She grabs the MASTER LOCK off the locker do and throws it into the bag, too. INT. CHEETAH’S —- MAIN ROOM - CONTINUOUS Cassidy, wearing her coat, steps through the curtain with bag.

dialogues.speaker: CLUB D.J., (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Pam. She cuts across the empty stage, toward the exit. EXT. CHEETAH’S - CONTINUOUS Cassidy steps out of the club.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (to self) Pam.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy stands at a ROADSIDE PAY PHONE, ringing phone cradl to his ear. STEPHANIE’S VOICE This is Stephanie, you know what to do. (answering machine BEEP)

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It’s me. I promise I won’t call you ever again. (beat) I’m going back to the ring. You were right about me. Everything you said. Anyway... I just wanted you to know... (beat) Your daddy loves you. (beat) That’s all. He hangs up. INT. CASSIDY’S CAR - CONTINUOUS Cassidy is driving south on the New Jersey Turnpike. She’ her cellphone. On the passenger seat is the Fanfest flyer

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: There’s waffles in the freezer and some burritos if he wants for lunch. He knows where. (beat) I’m not sure what time I’1l be headed back yet. I’1l keep you posted as I go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy’s van is pulled over on the side of the interstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy is catching a nap as 18-wheelers barrel past.  105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy pulls into the empty-ish parking lot of the GREENVI CIVIC AUDITORIUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy enters the locker room with his wheelie bag.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, nah, business is rockin’. Just opened a third dealership. Randy looks down a row of lockers. RANDY'S POV: A huge, dark-skinned man in khakis and a BOB ZAYID PONTIAC polo is talking to SOME OTHER WRESTLER. Thi THE AYATOLLAH (52).

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: That makes two in Columbus, one in Dayton. Next 12 months, I’d say Cincy’s not out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER WRESTLER
dialogues.text: (not too interested) Wow... The Ayatollah looks up and sees Randy looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: Ram-A-Lam. Randy heads over.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (shakes Ayatollah’s hand) What’s up, Bob? (shakes other guy’s hand) Yo, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: Good to see ya, bro. Didn’t think we were gonna do this.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: Thursday night, I get a call, “It’s on! He’s back in!” I’m like “What?” The Ayatollah chortles.  106.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: When you get settled in, we should go over things.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: What things?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Y'know, the spots.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: Ah, we can just wing it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You don’t wanna hash it out? The Ayatollah gives him a dismissive, cavalier wave.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: It‘’ll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: We should have at least a basic plan.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: How’s this: I’m the heel, you're the face. Done. The Ayatollah chuckles. Randy walks off, highly annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (to other wrestler) Anyway, if you’re ever in Ohio, swing on by. I’1l make you a nice deal on a G6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy pulls into a gas station. She rolls down the wind

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. A GAS STATION ATTENDANT looks her way.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know where the Civic Auditorium is?  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The card is underway. Through a wall, we hear the muffled sounds of a MATCH IN PROGRESS: cheers, boos, crashes, etc Randy, sitting alone on a bench in just his jock strap, t up his legs. His focus and intensity builds.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Cassidy pulls into the lot. There’s a lot more cars than Randy pulled in.

dialogues.speaker: TIME LATER
dialogues.text: The building’s outer concourse. A handful of fans mill ab at a CONCESSIONS STAND and a SOUVENIR TABLE. Cassidy, handing a ticket to an USHER, enters the buildin She looks around the concourse, not quite sure where to g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, suited up in his tights, paces the floor, gearing himself up for the match. The only other wrestler in the locker room at the moment is The Ayatollah, doing neck ro nearby. Randy catches his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Ready to do this? Through the wall, ARABIC MUSIC starts to play.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: Believe so. The Ayatollah grabs a large IRANIAN FLAG leaning against lockers. He heads toward an ENTRANCE CURTAIN, Randy close behind.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through curtain) From the Islamic Republic of Iran, weighing in at 252 pounds... The Tehran Terror, the Beast Of The Middle East... (beat) The Ayaaa-tooo-laaaaaah!  108. The Ayatollah steps through the curtain, Iranian flag rai high. He is promptly greeted with LUSTY BOOS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassidy is walking around the concourse with a mounting s urgency. She spots a SECURITY GUY in a yellow windbreaker sitting by an UNMARKED DOOR. She heads toward him.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. INT. LOCKER ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Randy is peering through the narrow gap in the curtain, watching The Ayatollah make his entrance.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (faint, amidst the boos) Death to America!

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Randy. Randy, turning, is surprised to see Cassidy standing ther She looks tired and worried and scared.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Don’t do this. This is dumb.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: This ain’t the best time to talk.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about your heart?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I thought the doctor...

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: They always say that. Whatever you got.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: You could really hurt yourself.  109.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I know what I’m doing in there. (turns vaguely sad) Out here’s where I get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Out here’s what counts. The real world.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Fuck the real world. Nobody gives a shit about me in the real world.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: I quit my job, drove 14 hours through the night to get here. What do you call that? Randy looks away, unable to hold her gaze. Through the curtain, we hear the Arabic music DIE DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (from auditorium) And his opponent... A new, familiar song rises on the auditorium speakers. MUSIC: AC/DC - “IF YOU WANT BLOOD (YOU GOT IT)” The crowd roars.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (points to curtain) Listen to them! This is where I’m great. This is where I belong. Randy looks at the curtain. He looks at Cassidy.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: From Elizabeth, New Jersey, weighing in at 219 pounds...

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Randy. Please.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I’ll see you after the show.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: (grabs him) No.  110. He pulls her off.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Enjoy the show. He turns away from her, toward the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A true wrestling immortal, one of the greatest of all time... (beat) Randy “The Ram" Robinnnnsonnnnn! He steps through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy bursts through the curtain to HUGE CHEERS. There’s probably 700 people there in the 2,200-seat facility. INT. COMMENTATORS’ TABLE — CONTINUOUS Seated at a ringside table are the match’s COMMENTATORS, pair of wannabe Marv Alberts in their 20s. A sign taped t the table reads CAROLINA WRESTLING NETWORK. Next to the t is a VIDEOCAMERA on a tripod.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: There he is, folks! Randy The Ram! Randy raises a set of ram’s horns high in the air. Fans d the same in tribute.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: History about to be made here at the Greenville Civic Auditorium. Randy takes a long lap around the ring, ramming chair aft chair. His head gets a little bloody. The fans eat it up. Randy climbs into the ring, where The Ayatollah awaits. The cheers continue. Loving, appreciative, sustained chee Randy stands there soaking it in, basking in their love. He grabs the microphone from the ring announcer. He looks around. A hush comes over the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I just got one thing to say to you people...  111. Randy looks toward Cassidy, standing over by the entrance curtain. He looks out at the larger crowd.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you. LOUD CHEERS. Randy takes a contemplative pause.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You take your lumps and bruises in this game. But you know what? It’s all worth it. Because of you guys. Your cheers keep me young. They make me feel alive. (beat) In 1982, the year I wrestled my first professional match, I was six- foot-one. By 1993, I was five-foot-— eleven. Three back surgeries in 11 years knocked two full inches off my height. I may be down to five- eleven, but performing in front of you people has always made me feel 10 feet tall. And that’s the way it’s always gonna be. Randy looks toward Cassidy, who’s standing over by the entrance curtain. Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forever. Randy lowers the mike, finished. The fans CHEER WILDLY, t loudest cheers yet. As Randy nods appreciatively at the crowd, The Ayatollah SNEAKS UP BEHIND HIM with a folding chair. Fans shout, trying to warn Randy about the sneak attack, he doesn’t hear them. The Ayatollah SMASHES HIM OVER THE HEAD. Randy goes down. match is on. The Ayatollah picks up Randy and throws him into the rope Randy bounces back toward The Ayatollah, who lazily puts an elbow for Randy to run into. Randy practically has to his face to the elbow. Hitting the mat, Randy pops back u and grabs The Ayatollah. The Ayatollah, phoning it in, throws Randy into the ropes again. This time, The Ayatollah has a raised knee waiting Randy. Randy runs into it, doing his best to sell the sho  112.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (under breath) You're workin’ pretty light here. Randy gets up and grabs The Ayatollah’s arms. With a nift move, he flips The Ayatollah over his shoulder, SLAMMING HARD into the mat. Randy falls on top of him, pressing Th Ayatollah’s face into the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: Jesus. Relax. Randy flips The Ayatollah over onto his back, pinning his shoulder blades. The REF swoops in.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: One!... Two!... The Ayatollah KICKS OUT. They both get up. The Ayatollah toward the ropes. He bounces off. Randy braces for someth good, but all he gets is a feeble CHEST SLAP. Randy grabs Ayatollah and puts him in a headlock.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Anytime you wanna join in. Randy scoops up The Ayatollah and drops him over his knee with a BACKBREAKER. The Ayatollah grimaces in pain as he the mat. Before he has a chance to get up, Randy hits him with a FLYING ELBOW DROP. The Ayatollah gets up, pissed at the rough treatment. Randy goes for a dropkick, but The Ayatollah catches his ankles in midair. He JERKS UPWARD on Randy’s legs, sendin Randy CRASHING TO THE MAT on the back of his head. The Ayatollah falls on Randy’s throat with his knee. He grind Randy’s face into the canvas as Randy did to him.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE CURTAIN
dialogues.text: Cassidy is cringing. It’s hard for her to watch this.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: That better?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Much.  113. The Ayatollah picks up Randy and throws him into the rope Randy bounces back, flinging himself sideways at The Ayatollah. The Ayatollah catches him in mid-air, cradling in his arms. The Ayatollah drops Randy onto his bent knee Randy falls to the canvas, clutching his side. The Ayatol falls on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: Forgot how much fun this is. The ref swoops in.

dialogues.speaker: REFEREE
dialogues.text: One!... Two!... Randy KICKS OUT. As Randy “recovers”, The Ayatollah jumps of the ring and grabs a folding chair. The Ayatollah, climbing back in, props up the chair in a corner. He picks Randy off the mat and flings him at the chair. Randy VAULTS OVER IT, sailing through the ropes an OUT OF THE RING. He hits the concrete floor, CRASHING aga the metal barricade.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE CURTAIN
dialogues.text: Cassidy winces. She starts to tear up a little.

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah hops out of the ring. He stands over Randy, kicking him repeatedly. He grabs his Iranian flag, waving tauntingly at the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: Camelfucker! Fat piece of shit! The Ayatollah looks down at Randy.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: Pathetic. ("spits” on Randy) Pitiful godless infidel!

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: Boos rain down on The Ayatollah.  114.

dialogues.speaker: JUST OUTSIDE RING
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah takes the butt end of his flag pole and JAB into Randy’s side. Randy grimaces in pain. The Ayatollah unties the flag from its pole and WRAPS IT around Randy’s neck. He JERKS UPWARD on the flag, lifting Randy off the mat by his neck. Randy THRASHES AROUND, fighting for breath. The Ayatollah releases Randy from the choke. Randy crumpl to the ground, gasping for air. The Ayatollah picks up Ra by his hair and flings him back in the ring.

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah grabs the folding chair from the corner. He SMASHES RANDY OVER THE HEAD with it. Randy’s forehead is BLEEDING. The Ayatollah hits him again, taking dead aim a the forehead cut. MORE BLOOD. Randy crumples to the mat.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE CURTAIN
dialogues.text: Cassidy, alarmed, instinctively goes halfway toward the r

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Randy!

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah scoops up Randy and BODYSLAMS him. He falls Randy knee-first and starts punching him repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: (under breath) Wanna take it home? Randy’s eyes drift in Cassidy’s direction. RANDY'S POV: Cassidy is CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it, Randy! Randy turns back to The Ayatollah.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: It’s time.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: All you, bro. Lead the way.  115. Randy flips The Ayatollah over. Randy struggles to his fe He picks up The Ayatollah and levels him with a dropkick.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: Dropkick! (a second one) And another! (a third one) And another! His heart is POUNDING. The fans sense it’s near the end. chant rises:

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ram Jam! Ram Jam! Ram Jam!... Randy falls on top of The Ayatollah, putting him in a res move headlock.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ram Jam! Ram Jam! Ram Jam!...

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: Just listen to this crowd! The Ayatollah can hear how labored Randy’s breathing is.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: If you ain’t up to it...

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ram Jam! Ram Jam! Ram Jam!... Randy looks around at the crowd, chanting, hungry for the Jam. He looks The Ayatollah in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Let’s do this. Randy gets up. He lifts The Ayatollah off the mat, lockin with him chest-to-chest. He arches his back and thrusts h hips. The Ayatollah’s feet fly off the canvas as his legs whip into the air. His body does a COMPLETE FLIP as he sl onto his back. Randy stays with him, his body contorting tight BACK FLIP as he CRASHES DOWN on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: Lateral drop! Randy gets up. His HEART LURCHES. He lowers himself back down to his knees. Puts his hand t his chest. Something just happened.  116. Randy looks out at the crowd. The whole place is on its f

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ram Jam! Ram Jam! Ram Jam!... Randy’s heart LURCHES AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH
dialogues.text: Y’ okay? The Ayatollah sees he’s clearly not. THE AYATOLLAH (CONT’D) Just pin me. Randy looks out at the crowd again. The fans are in a fre

dialogues.speaker: THE AYATOLLAH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Finish it. Pin me. Randy is torn. He... GETS UP. Randy STAGGERS to the corner. His heartbeat is UNNATURAL DEAFENING. BA-BLOOM, BA-BLOOM, BA-BLOOM...

dialogues.speaker: ON CASSIDY
dialogues.text: Cassidy can’t take any more. She turns and WALKS.

dialogues.speaker: ON RANDY
dialogues.text: Randy plants a foot on the bottom rope. He looks toward Cassidy. RANDY'S POV: He catches a glimpse of Cassidy disappearing through the curtain into the locker room. Randy looks out on the crowd. Chanting, cheering. He star to climb. Standing on the top rope, he looks again at the curtain. She’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Cassidy exits the arena sobbing.  117.

dialogues.speaker: THE RING
dialogues.text: The Ayatollah lies on the ground in pain.

dialogues.speaker: ON RANDY
dialogues.text: Randy raises his arms and sticks his elbows out, pressing fists to the sides of his head to form a set of RAM’S HOR

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: Uh-oh, the horns are out... Randy takes a long look around the auditorium, lingering the fans’ faces, savoring their cheers. He SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: Here we go... BA-BLOOM, BA-BLOOM, BA-BLOOM... He LEAPS. FREEZE on Randy in mid-air, glorious and immortal. END.
